commit_message:
Add REST api support for cancel without rollback

We already have REST api support for cancelling a
UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS stack with rollback. This adds a
new action 'cancel_without_rollback' to allow for
canceling a create/update in_progress stack without
rollback.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I6c6ffa0502ab8745cfb2f9c5ef263f1e02dfc4ca
Closes-Bug: #1709041

commit_message:
Add option to ignore failures due to missing files

TripleO started using j2 template versions of environment files, and in
the normal workflow the templates are all rendered before calling the
process_multiple_environments_and_files() function. However, in certain
cases it can happen the j2 templates are not yet rendered by the time
we call the process_multiple_environments_and_files() function. In this
case it's OK to ignore the missing files.

This commit add a new `ignore_missing` boolean option to
process_multiple_environments_and_files() and related functions to
ignore missing files instead of returning an error.

Change-Id: Ia78e271ccdaf2618d4f0837ef84546f9d17b6822
Related-Bug: #1730650

commit_message:
CleanUp the virtualbmc jobs definitions

This patch cleans up the job definitions for
virtualbmc as they are moved in in-tree.

Depends-On:I3f77cd25c0a2fd2dc1e08af06fe432f019157045
Change-Id: I7c9f3d4024346bb611362d29372305add3499d02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs refs/changes/77/518277/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines:
- hosts: all name: Autoconverted job legacy-tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ipmitool-virtualbmc-src from old job gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ipmitool-virtualbmc-src-ubuntu-xenial tasks: - name: Ensure legacy workspace directory file: path: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' state: directory - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x cat > clonemap.yaml << EOF clonemap: - name: openstack-infra/devstack-gate dest: devstack-gate EOF /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m clonemap.yaml --cache-dir /opt/git \ git://git.openstack.org \ openstack-infra/devstack-gate executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | cat << 'EOF' >> ironic-extra-vars export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER_ISCSI_WITH_IPA=True" # Standardize VM size for each supported ramdisk case "tinyipa" in 'tinyipa') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=384" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE=tinyipa" ;; 'tinyipa256') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=256" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE=tinyipa" ;; 'coreos') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=1280" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE=coreos" ;; # if using a ramdisk without a known good value, use the devstack # default by not exporting any value for IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM esac EOF chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | cat << 'EOF' >> ironic-extra-vars export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX="ironic" EOF chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | cat << 'EOF' >> ironic-extra-vars export DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT="virtualbmc,$DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT" EOF chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | cat << 'EOF' >> ironic-extra-vars export DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT="pyghmi,$DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT" EOF chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | cat << 'EOF' >> ironic-vars-early # use tempest plugin if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "master" ]] ; then # NOTE(jroll) if this is not a patch against master, then # fetch master to install the plugin export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS+=' git+git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic'" else # on master, use the local change, so we can pick up any changes to the plugin export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS+=' /opt/stack/new/ironic'" fi export TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY=1 EOF chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x export PROJECTS="openstack/ironic $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/ironic-lib $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/ironic-python-agent $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/python-ironicclient $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/pyghmi $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/virtualbmc $PROJECTS" export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=true export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_VIRT_DRIVER=ironic export DEVSTACK_GATE_CONFIGDRIVE=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_DRIVER=pxe_ipmitool export BRANCH_OVERRIDE=default if [ "$BRANCH_OVERRIDE" != "default" ] ; then export OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH=$BRANCH_OVERRIDE fi if [[ ! "stable/newton stable/ocata stable/pike" =~ $ZUUL_BRANCH ]] ; then export DEVSTACK_GATE_TLSPROXY=1 fi if [ "pxe_ipmitool" == "pxe_snmp" ] ; then # explicitly enable pxe_snmp driver export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_ENABLED_DRIVERS=fake,pxe_snmp" fi if [ "pxe_ipmitool" == "redfish" ] ; then # When deploying with redfish we need to enable the "redfish" # hardware type export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_ENABLED_HARDWARE_TYPES=redfish" fi if [ "partition" == "wholedisk" ] ; then export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_TEMPEST_WHOLE_DISK_IMAGE=True" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_EPHEMERAL_DISK=0" else export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_TEMPEST_WHOLE_DISK_IMAGE=False" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_EPHEMERAL_DISK=1" fi if [ -n "" ] ; then export DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_BUILD_RAMDISK=1 export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_INSPECTOR_BUILD_RAMDISK=True" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"USE_SUBNETPOOL=False" else export DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_BUILD_RAMDISK=0 export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_INSPECTOR_BUILD_RAMDISK=False" fi if [ "bios" == "uefi" ] ; then export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_BOOT_MODE=uefi" fi export DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT="" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_COUNT=1" # Ensure the ironic-vars-EARLY file exists touch ironic-vars-early # Pull in the EARLY variables injected by the optional builders source ironic-vars-early export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"enable_plugin ironic git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic" # Ensure the ironic-EXTRA-vars file exists touch ironic-extra-vars # Pull in the EXTRA variables injected by the optional builders source ironic-extra-vars cp devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}'

commit_message:
Remove legacy python-ironicclient jobs

The legacy python-ironicclient jobs have been moved to the
python-ironicclient tree. This patch removes them from this repo.

Depends-On: Ie1ae1e6b70d07ff0be69de2cfe09e641ec50e815
Change-Id: I2dfd2794bbf9901709ba7c1f389ddf1fce057fb4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs refs/changes/76/516776/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: - hosts: primary tasks: - name: Copy files from {{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace/ on node synchronize: src: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace/' dest: '{{ zuul.executor.log_root }}' mode: pull copy_links: true verify_host: true rsync_opts: - --include=/logs/** - --include=*/ - --exclude=* - --prune-empty-dirs

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I26a04575de845c1f09e5853191e064f4b285222c

commit_message:
Add support for persisting events

This change extends the persister to read OpenStack
event objects from kafka topic and then stores
them into ElasticSearch.

Story: 2001112
Task: 4843

Change-Id: I35b0db67dc088e56ad281c84fc4b50fa7a064e44

commit_message:
Re-enable containerized fluentd

Now that we got a promotion, there is a container image for fluentd in
tripleomaster registry. We can finally re-enable the containerized
fluentd service in scenario0001.

Change-Id: I636e63f9b66dd47267fa40febf49a6ec9a6b7ef3
Related-Bug: #1721723
Closes-Bug: #1726891

commit_message:
Fix wrong permission on database during mysql_init tasks.

During mysql initialization, mysql needs to be able to write in the
database directory.

Closes-bug: #1730349
(cherry picked from commit 0d65e380caf89d8c486e8ea87571298a6687b680)

commit_message:
Set bind mount propegatation to shared for /var/lib/nova.

This is required for nfs exports mounted by the nova_compute container to be
visible to nova_libvirt.

commit_message:
Derive params support for ODL DPDK feature

Adding ODL DPDK condition to check whether DPDK feature
is enabled or not in ODL to support the derive parameters.
DPDK feature is enabled in ODL if OvsEnableDpdk
parameter is enabled in role parameters.

Change-Id: I64392c1cb96d8d40d22e70ed7992bb267cb27822
Closes-bug: #1714461
(cherry picked from commit 1444c1d16bb289effd56d03b363c86e350f9497a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/10/511410/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The role supports the DPDK feature in ODL if the OvsEnableDpdk parameter value is true in role parameters. odl_dpdk: <% let(role => $.role_name) -> $.heat_resource_tree.parameters.get(concat($role, 'Parameters'), {}).get('default', {}).get('OvsEnableDpdk', false) %> feature_dict: <% dict(DPDK => ($.dpdk or $.odl_dpdk), HCI => $.hci) %>
deleted_lines: # TODO: Need to update this logic for ODL integration. feature_dict: <% dict(DPDK => $.dpdk, HCI => $.hci) %>

commit_message:
Do not set cluster in maintenance mode during split stack upgrade

This change noops ControllerDeployedServer{Pre,Post}Config to avoid
getting the upgrade of a split stack deployment getting stuck due
to the cluster being in maintenance mode. For reference a similar
change has been done for the regular Controller role in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/487313/

Change-Id: Idd393011b3c4d0d236780e11a04a59d426750de1
Closes-bug: 1725175
(cherry picked from commit 8e92d7c6db6fcae863a250f63b01a98f7a3f3340)

commit_message:
Set ipc=host for services attaching encrypted volumes

Without ipc=host set, cryptsetup/devicemapper will never
see devices created when running "cryptsetup luksOpen",
causing the command to hang.

This is required for attaching encrypted Cinder volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1729419
Change-Id: Ic7184b1fbbafea266f8ec1e7974d0a4a2cf4d750
(cherry picked from commit 05b61472463d5dbde3f1b1285819044409a80e2e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/09/517209/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ipc: host

The oslo.log (logging) configuration library provides standardized
configuration for all openstack projects. It also provides custom

Change-Id: I882dfafc6101ba3b74b8e0ef120bfab03f602cb6

commit_message:
Replace logging with oslo_log

The oslo.log (logging) configuration library provides standardized
configuration for all openstack projects. It also provides custom
formatters, handlers and support for context specific logging (like
resource id's etc).
I think it's better to use the common logging module.

Change-Id: I882dfafc6101ba3b74b8e0ef120bfab03f602cb6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-senlinclient refs/changes/72/518672/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: import logging

commit_message:
Drop py34 target in tox.ini and setup.cfg

We support py35 now.We do not have python 3.4 in setup.cfg which declares the explicit
supported versions.so it is no need to keep the supoort for py34.
see:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/349069/

Change-Id: I476527b98fbb065fcfd82d707fca70b364518975

commit_message:
Remove ceilometer datasource driver from congress

This commit removes the ceilometer datasource driver support in congress, as
ceilometer API is removed in Queens release.
Reference:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/512286/

Change-Id: Ib7ade0951f8a85102d95a0f01c3d63337f6b2404
Closes-Bug: #1729761
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/27/517527/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- deprecations: - | Ceilometer datasource is no longer supported in congress as the ceilometer API has been deprecated in Ocata and removed in Queens release. So, congress no longer supports retreiving data from ceilometer.

commit_message:
Add release note for default securitygroup update

1. What is the problem?
Currently no release note for default security group update.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Add a release note for default security group update.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
None

Change-Id: I392e8062123f26b06f899277efb3eeec7fb83022

commit_message:
Fix grafana configuration to neutron-dynamic-routing periodic job

Currently grafana does not display results of periodic job for
neutron-dynamic-routing as grafana configuration to periodic job
is defined in an incorrect file for [1] and the file has incorrect
job name for [2].

[1] periodic-neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-tempest-with-ryu-master-scenario-ipv4
[2] periodic-neutron-dynamic-routing-py35-with-neutron-lib-master

Change-Id: Ie29713fc4e1123dce4dee3458ad9f2a0f357e07d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/09/493709/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support insecure SSL when talking to services

The certificates may not be known to Trove when doing requests
to the different services so support insecure requests. This
can be configured via the new config options

- nova_api_insecure
- cinder_api_insecure
- neutron_api_insecure
- swift_api_insecure

All new config parameters default to 'False' so nothing changes
if not explicitly configured.

This is useful if the services use SSL adn Trove wants to talk to theses
services without configuring the different certs.

Change-Id: Ib59abd1500baad132e5c9f53895fd1eca18ac4d7
Closes-Bug: #1535895

commit_message:
Added pytest support to setup.py test

It might be useful for small projects where 'testr' or 'nose' usage is
expensive.

Change-Id: I8048ed91287f9b11219d1ce6cf61ad1a91bb1482
Signed-off-by: Mikhail Ushanov <gm.mephisto@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pbr refs/changes/76/438176/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. """setuptools/distutils commands to run py.test via setup.py""" from distutils import cmd from distutils.errors import DistutilsError class _PyTestDummy(cmd.Command): """PyTest command class with empty handler.""" description = "Run unit tests using py.test" user_options = [] def initialize_options(self): pass def finalize_options(self): pass def run(self): print("Install 'pytest' package to run 'py.test' command properly.") class _PyTest(_PyTestDummy): user_options = [ ("pytest-args=", "t", "Run 'py.test' command with specified arguments"), ] def initialize_options(self): self.pytest_args = None def finalize_options(self): if self.pytest_args is None: self.pytest_args = [] else: self.pytest_args = self.pytest_args.split() def run(self): result = pytest.main(self.pytest_args) if result: raise DistutilsError("'py.test' command failed (%d)" % result) try: import pytest except ImportError: have_pytest = False PyTest = _PyTestDummy else: have_pytest = True PyTest = _PyTest

commit_message:
Unset MountFlags in docker.service systemd directives

Required to allow bind propegation options to be set on individual bind-mounts.
See https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/19625.

Also https://access.redhat.com/articles/2938171 for rational for using this
option in RHEL/CentOS 7.3.

Change-Id: I8a63c044e15d7ca0f54654e9fc9c5d878461aa25
Related-bug: 1730533
(cherry picked from commit 2366b5b2fe3bc97d11aa9c3a65660ff78a6dc6f7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/48/518548/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $docker_unit_override="[Service]\nMountFlags=\n" file {'/etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d': ensure => directory, require => Package['docker'], } -> file {'/etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d/99-unset-mountflags.conf': content => $docker_unit_override, } ~> exec { 'systemd daemon-reload': command => 'systemctl daemon-reload', path => ['/usr/bin', '/usr/sbin'], refreshonly => true, notify => Service['docker'] }

subject: Add --detailed-exitcodes when running puppet via ansible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-01 16:00:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/20a948c8d1d37e4a5dbb95e8cb6d8ab20f581c45', 'message': "Add --detailed-exitcodes when running puppet via ansible

puppet run on never fails, even when it should, since we moved
to the ansible way of applying it. The reason is the current following code:

    - name: Run puppet host configuration for step {{step}}
      command: >-
        puppet apply
        --modulepath=/etc/puppet/modules:/opt/stack/puppet-modules:/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules
        --logdest syslog --logdest console --color=false
        /var/lib/tripleo-config/puppet_step_config.pp

The above is missing the --detailed-exitcodes switch and so puppet will never
really error out on us and the deployment will keep on running all the
steps even though a previous puppet manifest might have failed. This
cause extra hard-to-debug failures.

Initially the issue was observed on the puppet host runs, but this
parameter is missing also from docker-puppet.py, so let's add it there
as well as it makes sense to return proper error codes whenever we call
puppet.

Besides this being a good idea in general, we actually *have* to do it
because puppet does not fail correctly without this option due to the
following puppet bug:
https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-2754

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ie9df4f520645404560a9635fb66e3af42b966f54
Closes-Bug: #1723163
(cherry picked from commit 11e599d116cfbf7df4dcd0e7670c3405a4224c1a)

commit_message:
Add --detailed-exitcodes when running puppet via ansible

puppet run on never fails, even when it should, since we moved
to the ansible way of applying it. The reason is the current following code:

    - name: Run puppet host configuration for step {{step}}
      command: >-
        puppet apply
        --modulepath=/etc/puppet/modules:/opt/stack/puppet-modules:/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules
        --logdest syslog --logdest console --color=false
        /var/lib/tripleo-config/puppet_step_config.pp

The above is missing the --detailed-exitcodes switch and so puppet will never
really error out on us and the deployment will keep on running all the
steps even though a previous puppet manifest might have failed. This
cause extra hard-to-debug failures.

Initially the issue was observed on the puppet host runs, but this
parameter is missing also from docker-puppet.py, so let's add it there
as well as it makes sense to return proper error codes whenever we call
puppet.

Besides this being a good idea in general, we actually *have* to do it
because puppet does not fail correctly without this option due to the
following puppet bug:
https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-2754

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ie9df4f520645404560a9635fb66e3af42b966f54
Closes-Bug: #1723163
(cherry picked from commit 11e599d116cfbf7df4dcd0e7670c3405a4224c1a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/22/517022/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set +e --detailed-exitcodes --color=false --logdest syslog --logdest console $TAGS /etc/config.pp rc=$? set -e if [ $rc -ne 2 -a $rc -ne 0 ]; then exit $rc fi # puppet with --detailed-exitcodes will return 0 for success and no changes # and 2 for success and resource changes. Other numbers are failures if subproc.returncode not in [0, 2]: if returncode not in [0, 2]:
deleted_lines: --color=false --logdest syslog --logdest console $TAGS /etc/config.pp if subproc.returncode != 0: if returncode != 0:

commit_message:
Temporarily disable fluentd from scenario001-multinode-containers

Mixing containers and BM is currently not working. Once the master
promotion will take place we will have a fluentd container and
can readd fluentd as a container and the problem should not re-occurr.

Change-Id: Iad97f7e0e4de56f46a46d2381fc1ea5822a2114a
Related-Bug: #1726891
(cherry picked from commit 35d91ddc6d11bb2696321fff4593d5cca3b0cba8)

commit_message:
Should not allow security group from other project pass API layer check when booting

Currently, the default behavior of neutron when list security groups is:
if you are "admin", response everything we have in the env, and if the
user uses a security group from other project to boot a server, Nova will
show no error in API layer check but error raised in compute layer.

This patch added a check of security group project_id with the
context project uuid, and raises exception.SecurityGroupNotAllowedToUse
if they don't match.

Change-Id: I04a9ccf75b871fd6b519d9fa79d229e6a2da1a3e
Closes-bug: #1691902
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/60/466160/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Should generate migration record after successfully claimed

Currently the migration record was generated before successful
claim, this may lead to an bad migration record if the claim
failed afterwards and reschedule also failed.

It could be better if we generate the migration records after
successfully claimed.

Change-Id: I63883ba3c2a27759a0d87fc3e782f9190f0acdc1
Closes-Bug: #1661793

commit_message:
Fix mysql instance create failed when enable skip-name-resolve

In the guestagent code, it create os_admin user only grant
privileges on host:localhost, but use host:127.0.0.1 to
connect to mysql. Modify host privileges grant on to 127.0.0.1
to avoid create instance failed when enable skip-name-resolve
in config file.

Change-Id: Ifa69461c8a55464f88aec001d067450eedccf172
Closes-bug: #1729225
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/40/517340/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: localhost = "localhost" host=localhost, grant_option=True, clear=password)

commit_message:
Add --workflow-name for specifying a custom workflow

A new cli arg, --workflow-name, is added to the "openstack overcloud
deploy" command which allows for overriding the default workflow name
used for deploying the overcloud.

A custom workflow could be specified to use the config-download steps
added in I7d7f6b831b8566390d8f747fb6f45e879b0392ba, or optionally, just
do the Heat deploy and then allow for manual running of the
ansible-playbook commands. These workflows will be added later, and this
cli arg will allow the user to choose which to use during overcloud
deployment.

blueprint ansible-config-download

Change-Id: Ibd981e533bfd7f7369a6b9c7fdcc39629d4e5ed7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/52/511552/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add --workflow-input to pass custom input to workflow

Adds a new cli arg --workflow-input that can be used to pass custom
workflow input values to the workflow used for deployment. In
combination with the previous patch,
Ibd981e533bfd7f7369a6b9c7fdcc39629d4e5ed7, this allows one to pass any
input value to a custom workflow provided by --workflow-name.

Change-Id: I016fefa91b222bde7af9d274bc9fd428d4ef5546
implements: blueprint ansible-config-download
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/77/512877/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not use “-y” for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I174c8a0c653e322bbf951d72445b1a43251baa7e

commit_message:
use qos api def from neutron-lib

The Qos extension's API definition was rehomed into neutron-lib with
commit I8ab3712850ec02278b3efb9161fc03236926b842 and neutron will
consume it with I3bb987920008d5a1d73cf4c5f37895d7f917c368

This patch removes the global attribute map update for the qos
extension in the Unit Tests. This isn't needed and is already handled in
extension loading.

Change-Id: I0a3bf607ef5197feac3f0fb4468027110971a10d

commit_message:
Do not use “-y” for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I58d11d0bb8976941ceda56a95112783090d211bf

commit_message:
compute CDM include all instances

Change-Id: I718ab33e9473e8ec9b17101282823fd6919f89df
Implements:blueprint compute-cdm-include-all-instances
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher-specs refs/changes/19/499119/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================== compute CDM include all instances ================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/watcher/+spec/compute-cdm-include-all-instances Problem description =================== When building compute CDM, we will exclude the instances excluded by the scope. It has terrible impact to Watcher. * To workload balance and server consolidation, the exclude instances in the scope are not added into the workload. So it would get incorrectly workload of the compute nodes, and exexute unreasonbale migrations. * To server consolidation, it would disable the nodes which still have excluded instances running. Use Cases --------- As an end user, I want watcher to give a more reasonable optimization. Project Priority ---------------- None Proposed change =============== Watcher should have a whole scope of the cluster, include all instances. So it would get the correct workload of the nodes, and make the correct optimization. * Compute CDM in Watcher should has a whole scope. Add 'exclude' flag to instance model, to show whether the instance is excluded in the scope, as following. class Instance(compute_resource.ComputeResource): fields = { "state": wfields.StringField(default=InstanceState.ACTIVE.value), "exclude": wfields.BooleanField(default=False), "memory": wfields.NonNegativeIntegerField(), "disk": wfields.IntegerField(), "disk_capacity": wfields.NonNegativeIntegerField(), "vcpus": wfields.NonNegativeIntegerField(), } When building compute CDM, set the 'exclude' flag 'True' if the instance is excluded in the scope. alternative solution, we keep a list of excluded instance in the compute CDM. Two feasible choice, my proposal is the first. * We also need change this function in ModeRoot. def get_node_instances(self, node, exclude=True): """get the instances of the node node: compute node exclude：If False, return all instances on the node. If True, return instances without excluded on the node. """ When caculate the node's workload, watcher should include the excluded instance. And when find the migration solutions, watcher should exclude the excluded instance. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: sue Work Items ---------- None Dependencies ============ Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None History ======= None

Change-Id: Iae65305cbc04b7af482032ddf06b6f2162a9c862
Closes-bug: #1726370
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2017-11-06 15:31:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/388e616404c46ce62af1766b0962e55f70b6ad41', 'message': "Move check_ha_state_for_router() into notification code

As soon as we call router_info.initialize(), we could
possibly try and process a router.  If it is HA, and
we have not fully initialized the HA port or keepalived
manager, we could trigger an exception.

Move the call to check_ha_state_for_router() into the
update notification code so it's done after the router
has been created.  Updated the functional tests for this
since the unit tests are now invalid.

Also add a retry counter to the RouterUpdate object so
the l3-agent code will stop re-enqueuing the same update
in an infinite loop.  We will delete the router if the
limit is reached.

Change-Id: Iae65305cbc04b7af482032ddf06b6f2162a9c862
Closes-bug: #1726370
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2017-11-06 19:04:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/bc0e29c663b5c73cd77fbc57f197fe9950613358', 'message': "Move check_ha_state_for_router() into notification code

As soon as we call router_info.initialize(), we could
possibly try and process a router.  If it is HA, and
we have not fully initialized the HA port or keepalived
manager, we could trigger an exception.

Move the call to check_ha_state_for_router() into the
update notification code so it's done after the router
has been created.  Updated the functional tests for this
since the unit tests are now invalid.

Also added a retry counter to the RouterUpdate object so
the l3-agent code will stop re-enqueuing the same update
in an infinite loop.  We will delete the router if the
limit is reached.

Finally, have the L3 HA code verify that ha_port and
keepalived_manager objects are valid during deletion since
there is no need to do additional work if they are not.

Change-Id: Iae65305cbc04b7af482032ddf06b6f2162a9c862

we have not fully initialized the HA port or keepalived

Move the call to check_ha_state_for_router() into the

in an infinite loop.  We will delete the router if the

commit_message:
Move check_ha_state_for_router() into notification code

As soon as we call router_info.initialize(), we could
possibly try and process a router.  If it is HA, and
we have not fully initialized the HA port or keepalived
manager, we could trigger an exception.

Move the call to check_ha_state_for_router() into the
update notification code so it's done after the router
has been created.  Updated the functional tests for this
since the unit tests are now invalid.

Also added a retry counter to the RouterUpdate object so
the l3-agent code will stop re-enqueuing the same update
in an infinite loop.  We will delete the router if the
limit is reached.

Finally, have the L3 HA code verify that ha_port and
keepalived_manager objects are valid during deletion since
there is no need to do additional work if they are not.

Change-Id: Iae65305cbc04b7af482032ddf06b6f2162a9c862
Closes-bug: #1726370

deleted_lines: super(HaRouter, self).initialize(process_monitor)

commit_message:
Add capability to configure simple-crypto backend for barbican

This introduces the ability to configure the simple crypto backend
through a general backends manifest. This manifest will gather all the
backends and enable the relevant configurations depending on whether
they're enabled via t-h-t or not.

Change-Id: I44391b91b01bc03c9773410152e117ec6bbba491

commit_message:
PermitRootLogin for hosts group

Allow login as root user to hosts.
We currently use root user for all our tasks, this causes the integrated
build to fail, and would cause all deploys to fail too, since ansible
can't log into the hosts as the root user.

Change-Id: I8d34cef23b81e5474b8f2c0e7b7d8bbac3a5dc00
(cherry picked from commit 4c92d37c01f59a4c8992863896a8ce0bc2074551)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/74/518474/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # All our ansible tasks run as root user, we need to allow direct root login security_sshd_permit_root_login: yes

commit_message:
PermitRootLogin for hosts group

Allow login as root user to hosts.
We currently use root user for all our tasks, this causes the integrated
build to fail, and would cause all deploys to fail too, since ansible
can't log into the hosts as the root user.

Change-Id: I8d34cef23b81e5474b8f2c0e7b7d8bbac3a5dc00
(cherry picked from commit 4c92d37c01f59a4c8992863896a8ce0bc2074551)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/73/518473/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
No longer import nose

Since Python 2.7, unittest in the standard library has included mulitple
facilities for skipping tests by decorators as well as an exception.
Switch to that directly, rather than importing nose.

Change-Id: I4009033473ea24f0d0faed3670db844f40051f30

deleted_lines: from nose import SkipTest raise SkipTest('Unable to verify object-expirer service') def test_expirer_object_split_brain(self): if len(ENABLED_POLICIES) < 2: raise SkipTest('Need more than one policy')

commit_message:
Add missing zuul v3 job definition

The previous patches to add tests to this repo for this
branch left out the actual job definition, resulting in
no tests being run for this repository.

This patch implements the job to ensure that tests are
run as they were before with jenkins.

Change-Id: I061fcbbce0757e81611ced8753ccc16a9deeb401

commit_message:
Setup neutron-lbaas-dashboard stable/pike zuulv3

Initial patch to setup neutron-lbaas-dashboard stable/pike branch for
zuul v3 jobs.

Change-Id: I6402a71bb831962441f6fa5a64a4bb91cf3e869c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas-dashboard refs/changes/70/515770/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - hosts: all name: Autoconverted job legacy-neutron-lbaas-dashboard-nodejs4-npm-run-test from old job gate-neutron-lbaas-dashboard-nodejs4-npm-run-test tasks: - name: Ensure legacy workspace directory file: path: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' state: directory - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x CLONEMAP=`mktemp` function cleanup { # In cases where zuul-cloner is aborted during a git # clone operation, git will remove the git work tree in # its cleanup. The work tree in these jobs is the # workspace directory, which means that subsequent # jenkins post-build actions can not run because the # workspace has been removed. # To reduce the likelihood of this having an impact, # recreate the workspace directory if needed mkdir -p $WORKSPACE rm -f $CLONEMAP } trap cleanup EXIT cat > $CLONEMAP << EOF clonemap: - name: $ZUUL_PROJECT dest: . EOF /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m $CLONEMAP --cache-dir /opt/git \ git://git.openstack.org $ZUUL_PROJECT executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -u set -e set -x # Prerequisites sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install -y apt-transport-https lsb-release curl DISTRO=$(lsb_release -c -s) # Install via nodesource curl -s https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource.gpg.key | sudo apt-key add - echo "deb https://deb.nodesource.com/node_4.x $DISTRO main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list echo "deb-src https://deb.nodesource.com/node_4.x $DISTRO main" | sudo tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install -y nodejs # Output to the log for debugging sake. node --version npm --version executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install -y xvfb chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install -y chromium-browser chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install -y firefox dbus chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -x sudo rm -f /etc/sudoers.d/zuul # Prove that general sudo access is actually revoked ! sudo -n true executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | DIMENSIONS='1280x1024x24' /usr/bin/Xvfb :99 -screen 0 ${DIMENSIONS} -ac +extension GLX +render -noreset 2>&1 > /dev/null & chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -u set -e set -x export DISPLAY=:99 npm install --verbose # Try running as a standard lifecycle script, otherwise try custom. npm_lifecycle_phases="publish install version test stop start restart pack" if [[ $npm_lifecycle_phases =~ (^| )test($| ) ]]; then npm test --verbose else npm run test --verbose fi # If no shrinkwrap exists, generate it. if [ ! commit_message:
ESFIX:Fix troveclient error with Chinese character

Now troveclient does not support returning Chinese characters, so
to make changes.This should also avoid other unicode output
problems

Change-Id: Ie948cff4e81806f17c697f50271992cc492c48f4
Closes-Bug: #1720490

commit_message:
Fix duplicate instancetask code.

Each kind of instance task should have a unique code,
BUILDING_ERROR_TIMEOUT_GA and BUILDING_ERROR_REPLICA has the same
code(0x54), UPGRADING_ERROR and UPGRADING = InstanceTask has the same
code(0x59).

Change-Id: I8851ea5cf1a85fb81d010e4d2cca24cea124033f

commit_message:
MongoDB create raise index out of range error

trove/common/strategies/cluster/experimental/mongodb/api.py
In MongoDBCluster.create,  use FOR loop to create config nodes.
But the code"for i in range(1, num_configsvr + 1)" means i start from 1,
while regions[i] in for loop should start from 0, otherwise would cause
the "IndexError: list index out of range" error.

Change-Id: I0e756685a11c6dafd9d44b7f5fe21e9affb10316
Closes-Bug: 1700055
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/86/477786/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for i in range(0, num_configsvr): instance_name = "%s-%s-%s" % (name, "configsvr", str(i + 1)) for i in range(0, num_mongos): instance_name = "%s-%s-%s" % (name, "mongos", str(i + 1))
deleted_lines: for i in range(1, num_configsvr + 1): instance_name = "%s-%s-%s" % (name, "configsvr", str(i)) for i in range(1, num_mongos + 1): instance_name = "%s-%s-%s" % (name, "mongos", str(i))

commit_message:
Merge haproxy-octavia-ubuntu into haproxy-octavia

Rather than have a lot of duplicated code, lets just have one
haproxy-octavia element.

Also moving adding of ubuntu backports to happen at 10- rather than 01-.
It is a good pattern to only make elements which begin at 10- or later
so it is easier for potential user added elements to run beforehand.

Change-Id: I396a71040153aa1c92a87d9f609eed25500c8748

commit_message:
Persist existing LPAR wrapper attributes in DefaultStandardize on resize

The DefaultStandardize object in pypowervm defaults the proc units
factor, max virtio slots, uncapped weight, spp, availability
priority, srr, and proc compat (note that the enable lpar metric
parameter isn't included in this stable/pike commit as the minimum
pypowervm requirement for Pike does not support that parameter).
nova-powervm does not pass in these parameters when resizing.

This results in these attributes being set to the default defined
by the DefaultStandardize object for every resize operation. This
change passes those parameters into the DefaultStandardize object.

Note that if the attributes were passed in as part of the flavor
then the flavor's values would be set later in the DefaultStandardize
object by the LPARBuilder.

Closes-Bug: #1722923
Change-Id: I0e9ad0dbbc35658e096636a454ad493492025420
(cherry picked from commit 4bad1ec1654b757c70100fbcc6f51505719d79d9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/58/514858/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, host_w, adapter, slot_mgr=None, cur_lpar_w=None): :param cur_lpar_w: The LPAR wrapper of the instance. Passing in this parameter signifies a resize operation. if cur_lpar_w: # Maintain the existing attributes in DefaultStandardize kwargs['max_slots'] = cur_lpar_w.io_config.max_virtual_slots kwargs['spp'] = cur_lpar_w.proc_config.shared_proc_cfg.pool_id kwargs['avail_priority'] = cur_lpar_w.avail_priority kwargs['srr'] = cur_lpar_w.srr_enabled kwargs['proc_compat'] = cur_lpar_w.proc_compat_mode kwargs['enable_lpar_metric'] = ( cur_lpar_w.allow_perf_data_collection) max_vslots = slot_mgr.build_map.get_max_vslots() if max_vslots > kwargs.get('max_slots', 0): kwargs['max_slots'] = max_vslots lpar_b = VMBuilder(host_wrapper, adapter, cur_lpar_w=entry).lpar_builder( instance)
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, host_w, adapter, slot_mgr=None): kwargs['max_slots'] = slot_mgr.build_map.get_max_vslots() lpar_b = VMBuilder(host_wrapper, adapter).lpar_builder(instance)

commit_message:
Set bind mount propegatation to shared for /var/lib/nova.

This is required for nfs exports mounted by the nova_compute container to be
visible to nova_libvirt.

Depends-on: I8a63c044e15d7ca0f54654e9fc9c5d878461aa25
Change-Id: I55859e744e3c2ebbd6975c96b84b6b0774dc6700
Closes-bug: 1730533
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/80/518180/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - /var/lib/nova:/var/lib/nova:shared - /var/lib/nova:/var/lib/nova:shared
deleted_lines: - /var/lib/nova:/var/lib/nova - /var/lib/nova:/var/lib/nova

commit_message:
Use rdoproject-based settings for containers and dlrn_hash for images

Jobs deploying with containerized overcloud are running with
docker.io -based settings. This review changes jobs running
on RDO Cloud to use rdoproject images and container settings.

Depends-On: Id8f0e4e2af57e8840d0aeb7eb9b9620e48d05279
Change-Id: I4d15094f9b8d0e4a9463a5f9b4e7a689a1585211
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/68/514668/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Container settings undercloud_docker_registry_mirror: http://docker-mirror.rdoproject.org docker_registry_host: trunk.registry.rdoproject.org docker_registry_namespace: "{{ release }}" docker_image_tag: current-tripleo

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-08 14:02:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts/commit/a304a0a744a04402537e870e885f2d25e42c0849', 'message': "tasks: lxc_cache_create: Use threads when compressing base image

Use multiple threads when compressing the base container image. The

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-08 14:26:34.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/lxc_cache_create.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts/commit/ea5daccdf19723d6b9a20b0356c52cb35267191a', 'message': "tasks: lxc_cache_create: Use threads when compressing base image

Before:

commit_message:
tasks: lxc_cache_create: Use threads when compressing base image

Use multiple threads when compressing the base container image. The
special value of '0' instructs 'xz' to use as many threads as the number
of CPUs on the system. This change improves the total amount of time it
takes to compress the image up to ~85%

Before:
lxc_hosts : Create lxc image ------------------------------------------- 28.42s

After:
lxc_hosts : Create lxc image -------------------------------------------- 3.98s

Change-Id: I5fa162e027882ada4e45a392ae3757f0658cd599
(cherry picked from commit 82f649db95942c4b58b5a53950625bb418dee0a1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/35/518535/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tar -Opc -C {{ lxc_image_cache_path }} . | {{ lxc_xz_bin }} -T 0 -{{ lxc_image_compression_ratio }} -c - > rootfs.tar.xz
deleted_lines: tar -Opc -C {{ lxc_image_cache_path }} . | {{ lxc_xz_bin }} -{{ lxc_image_compression_ratio }} -c - > rootfs.tar.xz

commit_message:
Remove ceilometer-collector from overcloud image

collector has been removed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504244/
and package is being deleted in RDO. Although a provides is being added
to keep backwards compatibility, let's remove it from t-p-e

Change-Id: I2d22d088a3adc900eaf995948ba7aaa6aa51ef86
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-puppet-elements refs/changes/15/512315/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: ceilometer_collector_package

subject: Get DLRN hash before setting up repos and images
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-17 21:00:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/1ae9a8ac46b63b9809f44f8b41b83061f287f8c0', 'message': "Get DLRN hash before setting up respos and images

When deploying with containerized overcloud and updating
containers prior to deploy, the DLRN hash of the images
used to install should match that of the containers' tags.

This review adds steps to get the DLRN hash and set the
images location, repos baseurl and containers tags.
It also updates the config/release/trunk files to
use the path to the DLRN hash related files.

commit_message:
Get DLRN hash before setting up repos and images

When deploying with containerized overcloud and updating
containers prior to deploy, the DLRN hash of the images
used to install should match that of the containers' tags.

This review adds steps to get the DLRN hash and set the
images location, repos baseurl and containers tags.
It also updates the config/release files to
use the path to the DLRN hash related files.

Change-Id: Id8f0e4e2af57e8840d0aeb7eb9b9620e48d05279

commit_message:
Unset MountFlags in docker.service systemd directives

Required to allow bind propegation options to be set on individual bind-mounts.
See https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/19625.

Also https://access.redhat.com/articles/2938171 for rational for using this
option in RHEL/CentOS 7.3.

Change-Id: I8a63c044e15d7ca0f54654e9fc9c5d878461aa25
Related-bug: 1730533

ovn: Remove setting of DockerNeutronApiImage param

tripleo-common sets the DockerNeutronApiImage and DockerNeutronConfigImage
to appropriate neutron ovn image when "openstack image prepare" is called
for OVN deployments.

Closes-bug: #1722543

commit_message:
tempest: conditional --provider:physical_network

Juniper Contrail associate the use of `--provider:physical_network` to a
SRIOV device. Which means the parameter cannot be used seamlessly.
With this patch, we use the argument only if `public_physical_network` is
not empty.

See: https://www.juniper.net/documentation/en_US/contrail3.1/topics/concept/sriov-with-vrouter-vnc.html

Change-Id: I983cc88f6f31ebb5deabbc8c67a3ec31f48b0f3d

commit_message:
Add support for multiple Cinder RBD backends

Add new CinderRbdExtraPools Heat parameter, which specifies a list of
Ceph pools for use with RBD backends for Cinder. An extra Cinder RBD
backend driver is created for each pool in the list. This is in addition
to the standard RBD backend driver associated with the CinderRbdPoolName.
The new parameter is optional, and defaults to an empty list.

Adding this feature requires changes in two areas:
o The extra Cinder RBD backends get created via a new Puppet parameter
o The Ceph client key that permits access to specific Ceph pools is
  updated to allow client access to the extra RBD pools

Implements: blueprint multiple-cinder-rbd-backend
Depends-On: I3318b9eaef607d6992f9a8cb605817b6f76dd331
Change-Id: If410ed43b2cc70094a3274c1488833fcaae56cca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/15/506715/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Add new CinderRbdExtraPools Heat parameter, which specifies a list of Ceph pools for use with RBD backends for Cinder. An extra Cinder RBD backend driver is created for each pool in the list. This is in addition to the standard RBD backend driver associated with the CinderRbdPoolName. The new parameter is optional, and defaults to an empty list. All of the pools are associated with a single Ceph cluster.

commit_message:
create subunit test results for the undercloud sanity check

In OpenStack health all the tests are marked as failures
because by default we create a failing subunit result
for all jobs.  We need to create results for the undercloud.

Related-Bug: #1729686
Change-Id: I4850eaadc09035577cb48a367c5f482ed07b7a32
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/57/517657/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ## * Install deps for subunit results sudo yum install -y python-os-testr # * Specify the function to test CLI ## :: function citest { "$@" local status=$? if [ $status -ne 0 ]; then echo "error with $1" >&2 generate-subunit $(date +%s) 10 fail undercloud_sanity | gzip - > {{ working_dir}}/testrepository.subunit.gz exit 1 fi return $status } TEST_START=$(date +%s)citest openstack user list citest openstack catalog list citest nova service-list citest glance image-list citest neutron subnet-list citest neutron net-list citest neutron agent-list citest ironic node-list citest openstack stack list generate-subunit $TEST_START $(( $(date +%s) - TEST_START)) success undercloud_sanity > {{ working_dir }}/undercloud_sanity.subunit
deleted_lines: openstack user list openstack catalog list nova service-list glance image-list neutron subnet-list neutron net-list neutron agent-list ironic node-list openstack stack list

commit_message:
Galera: add support for encrypted SST

When internal TLS is enabled, generate a galera config that enable
encryption of SST rsync traffic.

The configuration relies on a new sst script wsrep_sst_rsync_tunnel,
which encapsulates rsync traffic in a socat-based encrypted tunnel.

Change-Id: I1d6ee8febb596b3ab9dcde3a85a028ee99b2798c
Depends-On: Ia857350ac451fc1bda6659d85019962d3a9d5617
Closes-Bug: #1719885
(cherry picked from commit 9fb617eaea607bc3615edeaf4608fded55045ebd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/21/518521/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*sst_tls_cipher*] # (Optional) When enable_internal_tls is true, defines the list of # ciphers that the socat may use to tunnel SST connections. # Defaults to '!SSLv2:kEEH:kRSA:kEDH:kPSK:+3DES:!aNULL:!eNULL:!MD5:!EXP:!RC4:!SEED:!IDEA:!DES' # # [*sst_tls_options*] # (Optional) When enable_internal_tls is true, defines additional # parameters to be passed to socat for tunneling SST connections. # Defaults to undef # # [*ipv6*] # (Optional) Whether to deploy MySQL on IPv6 network. # Defaults to str2bool(hiera('mysql_ipv6', false)) # $sst_tls_cipher = '!SSLv2:kEEH:kRSA:kEDH:kPSK:+3DES:!aNULL:!eNULL:!MD5:!EXP:!RC4:!SEED:!IDEA:!DES', $sst_tls_options = undef, $ipv6 = str2bool(hiera('mysql_ipv6', false)), $sst_tls = { 'tcert' => $tls_certfile, 'tkey' => $tls_keyfile, } $sst_tca = { 'tca' => $ca_file } $sst_tca = {} $wsrep_sst_method = 'rsync_tunnel' if $ipv6 { $sst_ipv6 = 'pf=ip6' } else { $sst_ipv6 = undef } $all_sst_options = ["cipher=${sst_tls_cipher}", $sst_tls_options, $sst_ipv6] $sst_sockopt = { 'sockopt' => join(delete_undef_values($all_sst_options), ',') } $mysqld_options_sst = { 'sst' => merge($sst_tls, $sst_tca, $sst_sockopt) } $wsrep_sst_method = 'rsync' $mysqld_options_sst = {} } $mysqld_options_mysqld = { 'wsrep_sst_method' => $wsrep_sst_method, $mysqld_options = merge($mysqld_options_mysqld, $mysqld_options_sst)

commit_message:
Migrates storage-environment.yaml to ceph-ansible

Previously storage-environment.yaml defaulted to deploying Ceph
using puppet-ceph, this change defaults it to ceph-ansible instead.
In addition it adds a new storage-environment-external.yaml file
which should be used when using an external Ceph cluster.

Change-Id: I1dea3b7665dc0da2ab30a89e077ba36cd36b05fd
Closes-Bug: #1724182

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecated. Update references
to include the extension.

Conflicts:
    zuul.d/legacy-ironic-inspector-jobs.yaml
    - due to removal of grenade-dsvm job

Change-Id: I95c6dd53713fc1d0a287fce9b42afdce1eba198c
(cherry picked from commit 05230cca8cebe9c1d9a9fc9f8f5cf084ef5d8f57)

commit_message:
Move legacy ironicclient jobs in-tree

This moves the legacy python-ironicclient CI jobs into the
python-ironicclient tree, instead of storing them in
openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs.

This also changes the ironicclient-tempest-dsvm-src job to
inherit from legacy-ironic-dsvm-base instead of legacy-dsvm-base,
since the required projects are the same.

This will give us control as we migrate the legacy jobs to the
new ansible roles.

Change-Id: If0c072e357fbeccc3dee8cc06b96e1bfa42299a7
(cherry picked from commit 9232ebd6d9dda0f6ddec71fe3353abf9a08f31d0)

commit_message:
SUSE: Avoid repositoy refresh and metadata clean up

The only reason we do a refresh is to import the GPG keys and also to
ensure that our metadata is update. However, we don't really need to do
that since zypper is smart to check for outdated metadata. We can also
import the keys when we install packages or updating the distro.

Change-Id: I4f53f33dd31184d2e3c70c6ad93cea857b30895a
(cherry picked from commit 7cc10a7bea9fc0398a7b89cf95f307e9b338df04)

commit_message:
Fixed creation neutron api mapping for security groups

Fixed creation of security group and security group rule via
neutronclient api mapping.
There was a switch from novaclient to neutronclient
for creating a security groups and rules in change
5d5666b10e57a94bcde06c8a296002175d935c7b but
the argument mapping for this function has not been changed.

Change-Id: I1774b73c61adb3b44a61f3f56f99e85f278deb83
Closes-Bug: 1716922
(cherry picked from commit c93f5833e4100d2325994b1bdf8f0d12b70d00c7)

commit_message:
Do not set cluster in maintenance mode during split stack upgrade

This change noops ControllerDeployedServer{Pre,Post}Config to avoid
getting the upgrade of a split stack deployment getting stuck due
to the cluster being in maintenance mode. For reference a similar
change has been done for the regular Controller role in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/487313/

Change-Id: Idd393011b3c4d0d236780e11a04a59d426750de1
Closes-bug: 1725175

commit_message:
Remove checks for auth_token in JSON-based formatter tests

the auth_token will no longer be returned as-is, as a result of a recent
patch to oslo.context [1]. So this removes these checks from here as
they will break when we get a newer oslo.context.

[1] I2b245c1665c3587be3c476b803122788d186e5d5

Change-Id: Ib3fea55976fb7c469d7b86644cacb802046e561a

commit_message:
Get rid of ensure_* functions from db api

These functions are just aliases to get_* functions and
mostly useless. So it's safe to remove them and use get_*
directly.

Change-Id: Idfa33ca47ddddab384d3817ee17aae6d941f5e44

commit_message:
Add option for Neutron containers to log to stdout/stderr

This adds the option to get the neutron containers to log to stdout.
The option is disabled by default.

bp logging-stdout-rsyslog

Change-Id: I0f9d201d93da702b702e7ecf4b43a6d705389846

commit_message:
Explicitly set healthcheck command.

We were setting them in the Dockerfile's previously.  However this
caused the healtcheck commands to always run regardless of which
process we were running in the container.  This caused 'unhealthy'
containers at times they were never intended to be checked.  This
change makes it so they are explicitly set.

Change-Id: I7bc12d236b3cc7a52d3e6aa706fd04675dad3a9a

commit_message:
Add all services to container scenarios

This commit brings the multinode containers scenario files closer to
their BM variants to add missing services and turning pacemaker on.
These require refactorings in OOOQ in order to support non-containerized
to containerized upgrade jobs across releases. Ceph-ansible is also
going to be switched separately.

Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add missing IronicInspector service

This is used to select which images to include in the generated files
by passing the heat environment file and role to the 'openstack
overcloud container image prepare' command.

Change-Id: Iefd11f6abdf209b3675aba8cbaa6b0da5619b2f7

commit_message:
Add steps needed when using OVB with a testenv broker

This continues the work to merge the OVB playbook in tripleo-ci with
the OVB playbook here. This should again be a no-op change, with the
only new behavior turned on by setting use_testenv_broker=true.

This change completes the differences between the two playbooks before
the undercloud is installed. There are also slight differences in what
we do after the undercloud is installed in the
baremetal-quickstart-extras playbook. Those will be addressed in the
final patch of this series.

Change-Id: Id24b8c4866f46dcb37a98b682f54101a341f9adb

commit_message:
Fix rights to local_settings.d for dockerized Horizon

For some reasonf that directory doesn't have r/x rights, so when
compress is ran as root, it can access config files in it, but when
horizon is run by apache, it can't, and expects different theme files,
thus failing with OfflineGenerationError. Giving apache access to that
directory fixes the problem and makes the custom theme work.

Closes-bug: #1730911
Change-Id: I53f6db23b036bc9b5a689bbac958550f384194c6

commit_message:
Revert "Addition of Nuage as mechanism driver for ML2"

This reverts commit 0bc2403ecfe995d3e1a40d40a30f4b63e57cceab.

The patch changed the default firewall_driver used for all ml2
deployments, from iptables_hybrid to openvswitch.

Change-Id: I72e750adbe2d269998f2cf274144d05ce17b4775

commit_message:
Update release notes

This updates the release notes to:
- indicate that we changed the default API version from '1.9' to 'latest'
- use the term 'Bare Metal API version' as opposed to 'ironic API version'

Change-Id: Idf22673d8b73643393e2f15fa7bd9d8bd39368e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/67/518567/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ``ironic`` commands changed from ``1.9`` to ``latest``. ``latest`` is the maximum version understood by both the client and the server. This change makes the CLI automatically pull in new features and changes (including potentially breaking), from servers.
deleted_lines: ``ironic`` commands is ``latest``, the maximum version understood by both the client and the server. This change makes the CLI automatically pull in new features and changes (including potentially breaking), from servers.

commit_message:
[reno] Prelude for release 2.0

This adds a prelude for the 2.0 major release:

- default API version is 'latest' for both OSC and ironic CLI
- no python-openstackclient requirement
- deprecated 'ironic' CLI

Change-Id: I14d8b286e932cc2b8422100515918612b1a3039c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/12/512812/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: | The 2.0 release has two major changes: * The ``python-ironicclient`` package no longer includes the ``python-openstackclient`` (OSC) package as a requirement. ``python-openstackclient`` is needed if using the ``openstack baremetal`` CLI. The package can be installed separately or installed along with ``python-ironicclient`` via ``pip``, by specifying the new ``cli`` extra: .. code-block:: shell pip install python-ironicclient[cli] * The ``ironic`` command line interface (``ironic`` commands) is deprecated and will be removed in the OpenStack S* release. Please use the ``openstack baremetal`` CLI instead.

commit_message:
remove branch specific logic

- newton is EOL. let's just move on
- ocata needs to have gnocchi configured through pip rather than
devstack

Change-Id: Ic3f97a44a3ef7a4d50e1f83b6dae0a78530d73a5

'"enable_plugin panko git://git.openstack.org/openstack/panko" export OVERRIDE_GNOCCHI_PROJECT_BRANCH="stable/3.1" export PROJECTS="openstack/panko $PROJECTS openstack/gnocchi" ;; *) export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'

commit_message:
Revert "Using assertFalse(A) instead of assertEqual(False, A)"

This is not correct,
because assertEqual(False, A) is a stricter check than assertFalse(A).
assertFalse(None) passes, but assertEqual(False, None) will fail.
Therefore, this patch weakened our tests.

Change-Id: I9bbb5d020bda237472f1edc85eab45460d5b5fb2

deleted_lines: self.assertFalse(robj.__eq__(other)) self.assertFalse(robj.__eq__(other)) self.assertFalse(robj.is_loaded)

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I888edf46f6f3a3ada068684162fcad382a019393

commit_message:
Improve node count indicator in roles step

Instead of only saying how many nodes are available for assignment, we now also
say how many require further action, and how many have already been assigned.
We also indicate how many nodes are in the system altogether.

Change-Id: I061277672a21e382676043245af60882127133f7
(cherry picked from commit 983d3d0b5eea173a1ef5a950e22f71e286039a38)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui refs/changes/55/518555/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: defaultMessage: '{nodesCount} Nodes available to assign' const nodesCount = ( {Math.max(0, availableNodesCount - totalAssignedNodesCount)} values={{ nodesCount: nodesCount }}

commit_message:
Healthcheck for nova_migration_target container

nova_migration_target container reuses nova_compute container,
so we have to adapt the health check to support both containers.

Closes-Bug: #1730649
Change-Id: Id48e32b43d2e0cd4319905131f1c0bee9774e5f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/98/518298/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: healthcheck_listen () { process=$1 # ss truncate command name to 15 characters and this behaviour # cannot be diabled if [ ${#process} -gt 15 ] ; then process=${process:0:15} fi shift 1 args=$@ ports=${args// /|} ss -lnp | awk '{print $5,"-",$7}' | egrep ":($ports)" | grep "$process" }

commit_message:
Fix health_manager to exit without waiting

When trying to exit health_manager the terminal
would hang due to a child process using time.sleep().
Now the process uses futurist.periodics to schedule
when to run which allows it to quickly and gracefully
exit.

Also handles the `failover_amphora` not working out or being
cancelled correctly and logging the statistics of those occurences
instead of incorrectly assuming everything always works out.

Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Joshua Harlow <jxharlow@godaddy.com>

Change-Id: I870edaab73ab20a9322c8bc1bd2514897417d12a

commit_message:
Addition of Nuage as mechanism driver for ML2

Adding composable services for Nuage mechanism driver for ML2. This
is separate from Nuage as the core plugin and intentional duplication
of Nuage under puppet services. Parameters required for working of
Nuage as mechanism driver are also added.

Change-Id: I2b564610721152c4f4dab9da79442256ba8d0b33

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I3141f12d0de00c3d8def2862881326f349edd479
(cherry picked from commit 644f2c326fa2a584dfe391bfccf78e36f2e63408)

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I3141f12d0de00c3d8def2862881326f349edd479
(cherry picked from commit 644f2c326fa2a584dfe391bfccf78e36f2e63408)

Add stables to patchbot for *-powervm

Have patchbot report *-powervm patches to stable/ocata and stable/pike
in #openstack-powervm.

commit_message:
[networking-odl] Fix grafana dashboards

As part of the Zuul migration the grafana dashboards broke because of
the way the statistics need to accessed, as well as a difference in
naming of the jobs. This patch addresses both issues and also brings
up-to-date the graphs with the jobs defined in the Zuul definitions.

Depends-On: I1270bcb260ea324b51eb6e6e9e9fef2a61ef5e27
Change-Id: Ia4fa570647751014df97c418ed985850a0d8f946

Remove opensdk jobs

these jobs have been removed from project-config in
I2c7f6a0cb7f1acd38556a37c866bd35ea3369600, remove them here as well.

commit_message:
Add zuul3 jobs in-tree

copied all over from general config repos,
renamed to better match how ironic now names jobs.

Conflicts:
    The grenade-dsvm job was removed. Since stable/newton has
    been EOL'd and doesn't exist, the job tries to upgrade from
    master instead of newton, and it fails.

Change-Id: If8195b909dba152e978aac33241424ecfd0777dd
(cherry picked from commit 843ca2258b86d81f1d2dd6362b6589fa0446aa09)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/11/517011/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
- hosts: all name: Autoconverted job legacy-tempest-dsvm-ironic-inspector-discovery from old job gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-inspector-discovery-ubuntu-xenial tasks: - name: Ensure legacy workspace directory file: path: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' state: directory - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x cat > clonemap.yaml << EOF clonemap: - name: openstack-infra/devstack-gate dest: devstack-gate EOF /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m clonemap.yaml --cache-dir /opt/git \ git://git.openstack.org \ openstack-infra/devstack-gate executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | cat << 'EOF' >> ironic-extra-vars export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER_ISCSI_WITH_IPA=True" # Standardize VM size for each supported ramdisk case "tinyipa" in 'tinyipa') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=384" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE=tinyipa" ;; 'tinyipa256') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=256" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE=tinyipa" ;; 'coreos') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=1280" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE=coreos" ;; # if using a ramdisk without a known good value, use the devstack # default by not exporting any value for IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM esac EOF chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | cat << 'EOF' >> ironic-extra-vars export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX="InspectorDiscoveryTest" EOF chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | cat << 'EOF' >> ironic-extra-vars export PROJECTS="openstack/ironic-inspector $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/python-ironic-inspector-client $PROJECTS" export DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_INSPECTOR=1 export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"enable_plugin ironic-inspector git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-inspector" # use tempest plugin if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "master" ]] ; then # NOTE(jroll) if this is not a patch against master, then # fetch master to install the plugin export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS+=' git+git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-inspector'" else # on master, use the local change, so we can pick up any changes to the plugin export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS+=' /opt/stack/new/ironic-inspector'" fi export IRONIC_INSPECTOR_AUTO_DISCOVERY=1 if [ "$IRONIC_INSPECTOR_AUTO_DISCOVERY" == "1" ]; then # discovery test requires sudo for iptables and virsh export DEVSTACK_GATE_REMOVE_STACK_SUDO=0 # enable enroll hook export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_INSPECTOR_NODE_NOT_FOUND_HOOK=enroll" # we are deleting node from ironic for simulate node discovery, # so inspector has to sync cache asap export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_INSPECTOR_CLEAN_UP_PERIOD=5" fi # Make IPXE configuration consistent between Mitaka and Master export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_IPXE_ENABLED=True" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_INSPECTOR_RAMDISK_ELEMENT=ironic-agent" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_INSPECTOR_MANAGE_FIREWALL=True" EOF chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | cat << 'EOF' >> ironic-vars-early # use tempest plugin if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "master" ]] ; then # NOTE(jroll) if this is not a patch against master, then # fetch master to install the plugin export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS+=' git+git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic'" else # on master, use the local change, so we can pick up any changes to the plugin export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS+=' /opt/stack/new/ironic'" fi export TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY=1 EOF chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x export PROJECTS="openstack/ironic $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/ironic-lib $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/ironic-python-agent $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/python-ironicclient $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/pyghmi $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/virtualbmc $PROJECTS" export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=true export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_VIRT_DRIVER=ironic export DEVSTACK_GATE_CONFIGDRIVE=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_DRIVER=agent_ipmitool export BRANCH_OVERRIDE=default if [ "$BRANCH_OVERRIDE" != "default" ] ; then export OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH=$BRANCH_OVERRIDE fi if [[ ! "stable/newton stable/ocata stable/pike" =~ $ZUUL_BRANCH ]] ; then export DEVSTACK_GATE_TLSPROXY=1 fi if [ "agent_ipmitool" == "pxe_snmp" ] ; then # explicitly enable pxe_snmp driver export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_ENABLED_DRIVERS=fake,pxe_snmp" fi if [ "agent_ipmitool" == "redfish" ] ; then # When deploying with redfish we need to enable the "redfish" # hardware type export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_ENABLED_HARDWARE_TYPES=redfish" fi if [ "wholedisk" == "wholedisk" ] ; then export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_TEMPEST_WHOLE_DISK_IMAGE=True" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_EPHEMERAL_DISK=0" else export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_TEMPEST_WHOLE_DISK_IMAGE=False" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_EPHEMERAL_DISK=1" fi if [ -n "" ] ; then export DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_BUILD_RAMDISK=1 export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_INSPECTOR_BUILD_RAMDISK=True" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"USE_SUBNETPOOL=False" else export DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_BUILD_RAMDISK=0 export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_INSPECTOR_BUILD_RAMDISK=False" fi if [ "bios" == "uefi" ] ; then export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_BOOT_MODE=uefi" fi export DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT="" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_COUNT=1" # Ensure the ironic-vars-EARLY file exists touch ironic-vars-early # Pull in the EARLY variables injected by the optional builders source ironic-vars-early export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'

commit_message:
Remove unused legacy-elastic-recheck-docs

The job is unused, remove it.

Change-Id: I253cf2d5aef8a731d2632d4b683f80d21083c93a
Depends-On: I99082384c638a159e2600bd8da97b86e93c77c2a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs refs/changes/59/517759/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: - hosts: all name: Autoconverted job legacy-elastic-recheck-docs from old job elastic-recheck-docs tasks: - name: Ensure legacy workspace directory file: path: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' state: directory - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x CLONEMAP=`mktemp` function cleanup { # In cases where zuul-cloner is aborted during a git # clone operation, git will remove the git work tree in # its cleanup. The work tree in these jobs is the # workspace directory, which means that subsequent # jenkins post-build actions can not run because the # workspace has been removed. # To reduce the likelihood of this having an impact, # recreate the workspace directory if needed mkdir -p $WORKSPACE rm -f $CLONEMAP } trap cleanup EXIT cat > $CLONEMAP << EOF clonemap: - name: $ZUUL_PROJECT dest: . EOF /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m $CLONEMAP --cache-dir /opt/git \ git://git.openstack.org $ZUUL_PROJECT executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -x sudo rm -f /etc/sudoers.d/zuul # Prove that general sudo access is actually revoked ! sudo -n true executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/run-docs.sh venv chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}'

commit_message:
Replace the deprecated nova_metadata_ip

As [1], the option nova_metadata_ip has been deprecated and
we can use nova_metadata_host instead. This patch makes devstack
do it.

[1]: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron/tree/neutron/conf/agent/metadata/config.py#n49

Change-Id: Ifda43ec8c7743af6acdd3003c55c081ef5b1311c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/97/511297/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $NEUTRON_META_CONF DEFAULT nova_metadata_host $SERVICE_HOST
deleted_lines: iniset $NEUTRON_META_CONF DEFAULT nova_metadata_ip $SERVICE_HOST

commit_message:
Fix missing neutron net plugin options

They are missing from the sample config produced by
oslo-config-generator due to omissions in manila/opts.py.

Add them.

Closes-Bug: #1728463

Change-Id: Ibc473af77fde48e3a5e761e0b959d145acd7fbf9
(cherry picked from commit 2a8cd75583d06ce5be665f8fba03d5cb4a8ebcb4)

commit_message:
Fix icons alignment in IE11/Edge browsers

text-anchor and dominant-baseline properties are calculated
in an other way in MS browsers. That's why we have to use
X and Y properties for text in icons in SVG.

Closes-Bug: #1716879
Change-Id: Ic639e7376a755198d264d0dd6d1d9edd156ddae6

commit_message:
Improve node count indicator in roles step

Instead of only saying how many nodes are available for assignment, we now also
say how many require further action, and how many have already been assigned.
We also indicate how many nodes are in the system altogether.

Change-Id: I061277672a21e382676043245af60882127133f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui refs/changes/74/516674/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: defaultMessage: `{availableNodesCount} total nodes ({totalAssignedNodesCount, number} assigned to roles, {nodesCount, number} available for assignment, {nodesRequireActionCount, number} require action)` allNodesCount, const nodesCount = Math.max(0, availableNodesCount - totalAssignedNodesCount); const nodesRequireActionCount = Math.max( 0, allNodesCount - availableNodesCount values={{ nodesCount, availableNodesCount, totalAssignedNodesCount, nodesRequireActionCount }} allNodesCount: PropTypes.number.isRequired,
deleted_lines: defaultMessage: '{nodesCount} Nodes available to assign' const nodesCount = ( {Math.max(0, availableNodesCount - totalAssignedNodesCount)} values={{ nodesCount: nodesCount }}

commit_message:
Set DLRN hash when release file contains dlrn_hash variable

When deploying with containerized overcloud and updating
containers prior to deploy, the DLRN hash of the images
used to install should match that of the containers' tags.

This review adds steps to get the DLRN hash and set the
repos baseurl. The containers tags will be redefined per
the dlrn_hash variable set.

Change-Id: Ib4f28dfe16e728ff015de11fa59cf21b028b3d34
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/78/513478/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set the DLRN hash if the $OPT_RELEASE file depends on a specific # DRLN hash or a release hash. # If the $OPT_RELEASE file does not have drln_hash defined, no action # will be taken. DEFINED_RELEASE_TAGS=( "current" "consistent" \ "current-tripleo" "current-tripleo-rdo" "tripleo-ci-testing" \ "current-tripleo-rdo-internal" ) REL_DRLN_HASH=$( cat $OPT_WORKDIR/config/release/$OPT_RELEASE.yml | grep -oP "dlrn_hash: \K.*" ) if [ "$REL_DRLN_HASH" == "[a-zA-Z0-9]{40}_[a-zA-Z0-9]{8}" ]; then DLRN_HASH=$REL_DRLN_HASH elif [ "$DEFINED_RELEASE_TAGS" ~= "(^|[[:space:]])$REL_DRLN_HASH($|[[:space:]])" ]; then DLRN_REPO_FILE=$( curl https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-$OPT_RELEASE/$REL_DRLN_HASH/delorean.repo ) DLRN_HASH=$( echo $DLRN_REPO_FILE | grep baseurl | grep -Eo '[a-zA-Z0-9]{40}_[a-zA-Z0-9]{8}') elif [ "$REL_DRLN_HASH" == "*/*/*" ]; then echo "ERROR: DLRN hash should not include directories and path slashes" exit 1 fi # Set the baseurl for repo-setup to match the full DRLN hash path if [ ! -z $DLRN_HASH ]; then sed -i "s#baseurl: https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-{{ release }}/{{ dlrn_hash }}#\ baseurl: https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-{{ release }}/{{ dlrn_hash[:2] }}/{{ dlrn_hash[2:4] }}/{{{ dlrn_hash }}#" \ $OPT_WORKDIR/config/release/$OPT_RELEASE.yml fi [[ ! -z $DLRN_HASH ]] && -e dlrn_hash=$DLRN_HASH \

commit_message:
Cleaned up formats for qos panel

Data formats added for qos panel - this makes the updated and created
date formats legible.

Change-Id: Ib0e364b51de6388395506a1f84454c9d1dc874da
Closes-Bug: #1721502

commit_message:
Fetch Cinder availability zones list for volume creation

We have to fetch and show Cinder availability zones list during volume
creation and volume creation from image.

Closes-Bug: #1721286
(cherry picked from commit b9972f73b008c48618909240665e80550e7fc3ed)
