commit_message:
Rolling upgrades related dev documentation

Adds a new 'Rolling Upgrades' developer document that describes the
design (from the associated spec) and includes notes on what to do
when developing a new feature or modifying an IronicObject.

Replaces the rolling upgrades information in the code contribution
guide, with a link to this new Rolling Upgrades page.

Change-Id: I5cc0b42da6e9e66f5c607bddbb3a2232cda97c6f
Closes-Bug: #1526283
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/39/419439/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Ironic implements rolling upgrades described in the `Upgrade Guide <deploy/upgrade-guide>`_. The upgrade procedure can be summarized in the following steps: #. Upgrade DB schema via :command:`ironic-dbsync upgrade`. #. Pin RPC and IronicObject versions to the old release for both ironic-api and ironic-conductor services, with the ``[DEFAULT]/pin_release_version`` configuration option. #. Upgrade code and restart services, one at a time. Start with ironic-conductor services, following with ironic-api. #. Unpin RPC and object versions so that the services can now use the latest versions, then restart the services in the same order as above. #. Run :command:`ironic-dbsync online_data_migration` to ensure that all DB records are "upgraded" to the new data version. Online data migrations ---------------------- Future incompatible changes in sqlalchemy models, like removing, renaming columns and tables can break rolling upgrades (upgrades when Ironic services are run at different versions simultaneously). It is forbidden to remove these database resources when they may still be used by the previous named release. When creating new Alembic migrations (decribed in the `FAQ <dev/faq>`_) which modify existing models make sure that the new columns are default to NULL. Test the migration out on a non-empty database to make sure that any new constraints don't cause the database to be locked out for normal operations. You can find an overview on what DDL operations may cause downtime in https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/innodb-create-index-overview.html (you should also check older, widely delpoyed InnoDB versions for issues). In case of PostgreSQL, adding a foreign key may lock a whole table for writes. Make sure to add a release note if there are any downtime related concerns. Backfilling default values, migrating data between columns or between tables must be implemented inside an online migration script. A script is a normal database API method, which accepts a max_count parameter (which you should use to limit the query) and returns a two-tuple with the total amount of objects to migrate at the start of the procedure, and the amount migrated. It should be added to the list of ``ONLINE_MIGRATIONS`` in ``ironic/cmd/dbsync.py``. Use the version column to select and update old objects.When the signature(arguments) of an RPC method is changed or new methods are added, the following things need to be considered: - New RPC methods are not be available when the service is pinned to the older release version. The new HTTP API functions should return a server error or implement alternative behaviours depending on the ``version_cap``. - Old methods can be removed only after they are no longer used by a previous named release.When Object classes (subclasses of ironic.objects.base.IronicObject) are modified, the following things need to be considered: - The change of fields and the signature of remotable method needs a bump of object version. - The arguments of remotable methods (methods which are remoted to the conductor via RPC) can only be added as optional, they cannot be removed or changed in an incompatible way. obj_make_compatible() will be called to convert objects to the target version during serialization. So objects should implement their own obj_make_compatible() to remove/alter attributes which were added/changed after the target version. Note that in ironic, objects are used to version objects stored in the database, so the obj_make_compatible() method may receive only a subset of fields which are used in the SQL update operation. - The object fingerprint in unit tests should only be updated with a version bump.
deleted_lines: Ironic implements upgrade with the same methodology of Nova: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/upgrade.html * When the signature(arguments) of an RPC method is changed, the following things need to be considered:* When Object classes (subclasses of ironic.objects.base.IronicObject) are modified, the following things need to be considered: - The change of fields and the signature of remotable method needs a bump of object version. - The arguments of methods can only be added as optional, they cannot be removed or changed in an incompatible way. obj_make_compatible() will be called to convert objects to the target version during serialization. So objects should implement their own obj_make_compatible() to remove/alter attributes which was added/changed after the target version. - There is a test (object/test_objects.py) to generate the hash of object fields and the signatures of remotable methods, which helps developers to check if the change of objects need a version bump. The object fingerprint should only be updated with a version bump.

subject: Simplify network_args
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-31 15:28:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/ca5aac351c0d6b6797f03576afa77fcd7e3236c5', 'message': "Simplify network_args

There are 3 distinctive variants: without net iso, net iso without
containers, net iso with containers. Any sub-variants like TLS can
hopefully fit in as if/else blocks into these, so that we don't have
to start drawing Venn diagrams for combinations of `when` clause
conditions :)

Change-Id: I08921c18dd660356eed64d4e1e1028ba485e5942

commit_message:
Simplify network_args

When network isolation is disabled, network_args already default to
being empty. For network isolation enabled are two variants of the
network_args fact setting: without containers, with containers. Any
sub-variants like TLS can hopefully fit in as if/else blocks into
these, so that we don't have to start drawing Venn diagrams for
combinations of `when` clause conditions :)

Also this commit removes containers-default-parameters.yaml from
network args. This should be provided via container_args, and nowadays
it's just for setting images and insecure registry params, so we
shouldn't need to put it again into network_args.

Change-Id: I08921c18dd660356eed64d4e1e1028ba485e5942
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/80/499680/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: set network_args fact when without network isolation set_fact: network_args: '' when: - not network_isolation|bool - name: set network_args fact for non-containerized {{ network_isolation_args }} when: - network_isolation|bool {% if enable_tls_everywhere|bool %} {% endif %} when: - containerized_overcloud|bool
deleted_lines: - name: set network_args fact {% if network_isolation|bool %}{{ network_isolation_args }}{% endif %} when: {{ network_isolation_args }} -e {{ working_dir }}/containers-default-parameters.yaml when: - containerized_overcloud|bool - network_isolation|bool - not enable_tls_everywhere|bool - name: set network_args fact for TLS containers set_fact: network_args: >- -e {{ working_dir }}/containers-default-parameters.yaml when: - containerized_overcloud|bool - enable_tls_everywhere|bool

commit_message:
Only mount selinux sysfs in nova_libvirt container

https://review.openstack.org/500952 initially just did this. Then we assumed
every container should have the selinux sysfs.
This causes issues with the sshd container used for live-migration.

The advice from the selinux experts is that it should not be enabled within
containers, so reverting back to the original fix that enables it only in the
nova-libvirt container.

Closes-bug: 1729405
Change-Id: I80bf38d7d64ab99510574af5c57423fde9b84eca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/66/515966/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - /sys/fs/selinux:/sys/fs/selinux

When SELinux is enforcing, use the docker volume mount flag
:z for the docker-puppet tool's bind-mounted volumes in RW mode.
Note, if a volume mount with a Z, then the label will be specific
to the container, and not be able to be shared between containers.

Volumes from /etc/pki mounted RO do not require the context changes.
For those RO volumes that do require it, simulate :z with the
chcon command, effectively allowing :ro:z for volumes, which docker
does not support directly.

For deploy-steps, make sure ansible file resources in /var/lib/
created with the same SELinux context attributes what chcon uses.

Related-bug: #1723003

commit_message:
Allow containerized undercloud deploy with SELinux

When SELinux is enforcing, use the docker volume mount flag
:z for the docker-puppet tool's bind-mounted volumes in RW mode.
Note, if a volume mount with a Z, then the label will be specific
to the container, and not be able to be shared between containers.

Volumes from /etc/pki mounted RO do not require the context changes.
For those RO volumes that do require it, use :ro,z.

For deploy-steps, make sure ansible file resources in /var/lib/
are enforced the same SELinux context attributes what docker's :z
provides.

Partial-bug: #1682179
Related-bug: #1723003

Change-Id: Idc0caa49573bd88e8410d3d4217fd39e9aabf8f2
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/69/513669/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: '--volume', '%s:/var/lib/config-data/:z' % os.environ.get('CONFIG_VOLUME_PREFIX', '/var/lib/config-data'), '--volume', 'tripleo_logs:/var/log/tripleo/:z', '--volume', '/dev/log:/dev/log:z', '--volume', '%s:%s:Z' % (sh_script, sh_script) ]
deleted_lines: '--volume', '%s:/var/lib/config-data/:rw' % os.environ.get('CONFIG_VOLUME_PREFIX', '/var/lib/config-data'), '--volume', 'tripleo_logs:/var/log/tripleo/', '--volume', '/dev/log:/dev/log', '--volume', '%s:%s:rw' % (sh_script, sh_script) ]

commit_message:
Env files for ODL deployments

This patch adds env files for SRIOV, OVS-DPDK, L2GW, BGPVPN
and SFC deployments with ODL.

These files contain configs not present in basic ODL deployment
env file. While deploying, these need to be used along the basic
deployment env file like

openstack overcloud deploy \
 -e environments/services-docker/neutron-opendaylight.yaml \
 -e environments/services-docker/neutron-opendaylight-dpdk.yaml

and

openstack overcloud deploy \
 -e environments/services-docker/neutron-opendaylight.yaml \
 -e environments/services-docker/neutron-opendaylight-sriov.yaml

and so forth for all other deployments.

Closes-Bug: 1722881

Change-Id: I2b70d3f4518e0c014cf37f7fecd92f69989f0860
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/01/512501/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Format should be comma separated per socket string such as: # "<socket 0 mem MB>,<socket 1 mem MB>", for example: "1024,0". #OvsDpdkDriverType: "vfio-pci" # Ensure the Overcloud NIC to be used for DPDK supports this UIO/PMD driver. #OvsPmdCoreList: "" # List or range of CPU cores for PMD threads to be pinned to. Also, specifying more than one core will trigger multiple PMD # threads to be spawned, which may improve dataplane performance. #NovaVcpuPinSet: "" # Cores to pin Nova instances to. For maximum performance, select cores # on the same NUMA node(s) selected for previous settings.

commit_message:
Add missing puppet configuration to undercloud deploy

For containerized underclouds, the docker-puppet tool expects
symlinks created for puppet modules by specific paths.
Ensure the client creates those instead of relying on multiple
external places, like quickstart or cuztom bash scripts or docs.

Related-bug: #1723003
Closes-bug: #1725329

Change-Id: I60255386051b80c2fcacb4770e079fd450074c53
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2058019c2f81e64fbac62ab04b7475037a723755)

commit_message:
Add containerized barbican environment

This environment enables the barbican API environment, and in the
future, it'll enable workers and the keystone notifier as well.

Change-Id: Ic7cf086a5f1d55c8faf703a5a3b96f7f9ab805f7
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Replace default gnocchi endpoint type

The default gnocchi endpoint type is publicURL in gnocchiclient.
This patch replaces default gnocchi endpoint type from
internalURL to publicURL
see https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/master/keystoneauth1/adapter.py#L347-L351

Change-Id: I00eb08e4a20dc5da6ca2fa2ea4bef4a3175c26a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/60/518460/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default='public', 'Supported values: internal, public, admin' 'The default is public.')]
deleted_lines: default='internalURL', 'Supported values: internalURL, publicURL, adminURL' 'The default is internalURL.')]

subject: Kombu: make reply and fanout queues expire instead of auto-delete
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-10 22:12:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/c8b9575f002df7e7d350ea6347d808b0462355cb', 'message': 'rabbit: Add rabbit_queue_ttl option

This causes queues to be declared with the x-expires argument,
defaulting to 300 seconds.  When a queue is unused (no consumers and
not re-declared) for the duration of the TTL, the broker will
automatically delete the queue.

This is an important complement to auto_delete queues, and it is
recommended to always have a queue TTL set.  Queues marked auto_delete
are only deleted if a consumer existed at some point, and then
disconnected, resulting in zero consumers.

Consider the following scenario: a client declares a queue
(auto_delete) and binds it to a fanout exchange, but before the client
can consume from the queue, it dies.

Because there was never (and will never be) a consumer of this queue,
the auto_delete logic does not fire.  The queue will live forever, and
will collect a copy of every message that is sent to the bound fanout
exchange.  Given enough published messages to the exchange, the queue
will eventually consume all available memory on the broker.

This is bad and we should avoid it by setting a reasonable TTL.

Change-Id: I83a8d09dc0cdae24c12d7043ec810529a9ce57ab

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-20 22:29:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/109f15bcf5d310d50bd3c0c6fe4795d6011ecfd6', 'message': 'rabbit: Add rabbit_queue_ttl option

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-13 15:14:43.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/10625eed87b4c7f980bd5cd7cacbc4caa2dec197', 'message': 'Kombu: make reply and fanout queues expire instead of auto-delete

Right now fanout and reply queues are unconditionally created with
auto-delete flag which causes a number of problems listed in bug
1495568. Replacing auto-delete with queue expiration with some sane
timeout should fix all these issues at once.

Another problem being fixed is that auto-delete flag does not causes
the queue to be deleted if it never had consumers. An orphaned fanout
queue might appear that way and it will grow indefinitely until
somebody manually removes it. See bug 1515278 for details.

A new rabbit_transient_queues_ttl config parameter is introduced which
configures the TTL for reply and fanout queues. It is a positive
integer representing timeout in seconds. By default it is set to 10
minutes. That should be enough for application to reconnect or
for server to send reply to client which already died. At the same
time, it seems that not so many messages could be accumulated in
fanout queues during that time.

DocImpact
With this change RabbitMQ driver defines reply and fanout queues
differently comparing with the previous release: now they are defined
with queue TTL (https://www.rabbitmq.com/ttl.html#queue-ttl) instead
of auto-delete flag. That helps avoid a number of issues, see commit
description for details. A new rabbit_transient_queues_ttl parameter
is defined which controls the TTL value. It is set to 10 minutes by
default. The change does not affect upgrade in any way.

Closes-bug: #1495568
Closes-bug: #1515278

Co-Authored-by: Dmitry Mescheryakov <dmescheryakov@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I83a8d09dc0cdae24c12d7043ec810529a9ce57ab

commit_message:
Kombu: make reply and fanout queues expire instead of auto-delete

Right now fanout and reply queues are unconditionally created with
auto-delete flag which causes a number of problems listed in bug
1495568. Replacing auto-delete with queue expiration with some sane
timeout should fix all these issues at once.

Another problem being fixed is that auto-delete flag does not causes
the queue to be deleted if it never had consumers. An orphaned fanout
queue might appear that way and it will grow indefinitely until
somebody manually removes it. See bug 1515278 for details.

A new rabbit_transient_queues_ttl config parameter is introduced which
configures the TTL for reply and fanout queues. It is a positive
integer representing timeout in seconds. By default it is set to 10
minutes. That should be enough for application to reconnect or
for server to send reply to client which already died. At the same
time, it seems that not so many messages could be accumulated in
fanout queues during that time.

DocImpact
With this change RabbitMQ driver defines reply and fanout queues
differently comparing with the previous release: now they are defined
with queue TTL (https://www.rabbitmq.com/ttl.html#queue-ttl) instead
of auto-delete flag. That helps avoid a number of issues, see commit
description for details. A new rabbit_transient_queues_ttl parameter
is defined which controls the TTL value. It is set to 10 minutes by
default. The change does not affect upgrade in any way.

Closes-bug: #1495568
Closes-bug: #1515278

Co-Authored-by: Dmitry Mescheryakov <dmescheryakov@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I83a8d09dc0cdae24c12d7043ec810529a9ce57ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/45/243845/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.IntOpt('rabbit_queue_ttl', default=300, deprecated_group='DEFAULT', help='Duration in seconds for queue TTL (x-expires). ' 'Queues which are unused for the duration of the TTL ' 'are automatically deleted. A value of 0 disables TTLs.'),def _get_queue_arguments(rabbit_ha_queues, rabbit_queue_ttl): If the rabbit_queue_ttl option is > 0, then all queues are declared with the "Queue TTL" value as described here: https://www.rabbitmq.com/ttl.html Setting a queue TTL causes the queue to be automatically deleted if it is unused for the TTL duration. It is important to note that a queue which is declared auto_delete, but never consumed from, will *not* delete. Because of this, a queue TTL is highly recommended to prevent such queues from growing indefinitely. args = {} if rabbit_ha_queues: args['x-ha-policy'] = 'all' if rabbit_queue_ttl > 0: args['x-expires'] = rabbit_queue_ttl * 1000 return args auto_delete, callback, nowait=True, rabbit_ha_queues=None, rabbit_queue_ttl=300): self.queue_arguments = _get_queue_arguments(rabbit_ha_queues, rabbit_queue_ttl) if exc.code == 406: # NOTE(jeckersb): Queue already exists with a # different set of options and/or arguments. This # will occur when attributes have been changed (ha # queues, queue ttl) but the queue in the broker was # declared with the prior setting(s). LOG.warn(_LW(exc.message)) pass self.rabbit_queue_ttl = driver_conf.rabbit_queue_ttl rabbit_ha_queues=self.rabbit_ha_queues, rabbit_queue_ttl=self.rabbit_queue_ttl) rabbit_ha_queues=self.rabbit_ha_queues, rabbit_queue_ttl=self.rabbit_queue_ttl) rabbit_ha_queues=self.rabbit_ha_queues, rabbit_queue_ttl=self.rabbit_queue_ttl) queue_arguments=_get_queue_arguments(self.rabbit_ha_queues, self.rabbit_queue_ttl))
deleted_lines: def _get_queue_arguments(rabbit_ha_queues): return {'x-ha-policy': 'all'} if rabbit_ha_queues else {} auto_delete, callback, nowait=True, rabbit_ha_queues=None): self.queue_arguments = _get_queue_arguments(rabbit_ha_queues) rabbit_ha_queues=self.rabbit_ha_queues) rabbit_ha_queues=self.rabbit_ha_queues) rabbit_ha_queues=self.rabbit_ha_queues) queue_arguments=_get_queue_arguments(self.rabbit_ha_queues))

commit_message:
Fix iscsi and tgt containers deployment case

In the following config:
enable_cinder=False
enable_cinder_backend_iscsi=True

Iscsi and tgt containers are deployed but should not.
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I1d66627b9979b5dc570bbc3e1e865311dd7e7bb0
Closes-Bug: #1715618
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/29/501729/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: enable_iscsid: "{{ (enable_cinder | bool and enable_cinder_backend_iscsi | bool) or (enable_cinder | bool and enable_cinder_backend_lvm | bool) or enable_ironic | bool }}"
deleted_lines: enable_iscsid: "{{ enable_cinder_backend_iscsi | bool or enable_cinder_backend_lvm | bool or enable_ironic | bool }}"

subject: libvirt: do not remove inst_base when volume-backed during resize
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-02 18:12:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/64f773ab96619b97de2bc521fdfc8400fdb7bd3d', 'message': "libvirt: do not remove inst_base when volume-backed during resize

When confirming a resize, the libvirt driver on the source host checks
to see if the instance base directory (which contains the domain xml
files, etc) exists and if the root disk image does not, it removes the
instance base directory.

However, the root image disk won't exist on local storage for a
volume-backed instance and if the instance base directory is on shared
storage, e.g. NFS or Ceph, between the source and destination host, the
instance base directory is incorrectly deleted.

This adds a check to see if the instance is volume-backed when checking
to see if the instance base directory should be removed from the source
host when confirming a resize.

Change-Id: I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a
Closes-Bug: #1728603
(cherry picked from commit f02afc6569bd930114a4b56413dbd6becc5e7e75)
(cherry picked from commit d5d81a29050966f47050f0f77001273b1aa55116)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: do not remove inst_base when volume-backed during resize

When confirming a resize, the libvirt driver on the source host checks
to see if the instance base directory (which contains the domain xml
files, etc) exists and if the root disk image does not, it removes the
instance base directory.

However, the root image disk won't exist on local storage for a
volume-backed instance and if the instance base directory is on shared
storage, e.g. NFS or Ceph, between the source and destination host, the
instance base directory is incorrectly deleted.

This adds a check to see if the instance is volume-backed when checking
to see if the instance base directory should be removed from the source
host when confirming a resize.

Change-Id: I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a
Closes-Bug: #1728603
(cherry picked from commit f02afc6569bd930114a4b56413dbd6becc5e7e75)
(cherry picked from commit d5d81a29050966f47050f0f77001273b1aa55116)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/90/517390/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: libvirt: do not remove inst_base when volume-backed during resize
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-02 18:05:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d5d81a29050966f47050f0f77001273b1aa55116', 'message': "libvirt: do not remove inst_base when volume-backed during resize

When confirming a resize, the libvirt driver on the source host checks
to see if the instance base directory (which contains the domain xml
files, etc) exists and if the root disk image does not, it removes the
instance base directory.

However, the root image disk won't exist on local storage for a
volume-backed instance and if the instance base directory is on shared
storage, e.g. NFS or Ceph, between the source and destination host, the
instance base directory is incorrectly deleted.

This adds a check to see if the instance is volume-backed when checking
to see if the instance base directory should be removed from the source
host when confirming a resize.

Change-Id: I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a
Closes-Bug: #1728603
(cherry picked from commit f02afc6569bd930114a4b56413dbd6becc5e7e75)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: do not remove inst_base when volume-backed during resize

When confirming a resize, the libvirt driver on the source host checks
to see if the instance base directory (which contains the domain xml
files, etc) exists and if the root disk image does not, it removes the
instance base directory.

However, the root image disk won't exist on local storage for a
volume-backed instance and if the instance base directory is on shared
storage, e.g. NFS or Ceph, between the source and destination host, the
instance base directory is incorrectly deleted.

This adds a check to see if the instance is volume-backed when checking
to see if the instance base directory should be removed from the source
host when confirming a resize.

Change-Id: I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a
Closes-Bug: #1728603
(cherry picked from commit f02afc6569bd930114a4b56413dbd6becc5e7e75)

commit_message:
Fix return type in FilterScheduler._legacy_find_hosts

The FilterScheduler._schedule method should be returning
a list of list of selected hosts. When include_alternatives
is False in _legacy_find_hosts, it was only returning back
a list of hosts, which would result in an IndexError when
select_destinations() tries to take the first entry from each
item in the list.

Change-Id: Ia6c87900605d3604beb74b942b0e30575b814112
Closes-Bug: #1729445

""" num_instances = 1 hosts = [host_manager.HostState( 'fake-host', 'fake-node', uuids.cell_uuid)] spec_obj = objects.RequestSpec(num_instances=num_instances) with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_get_sorted_hosts', return_value=hosts): with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_consume_selected_host'): selected_hosts = self.driver._legacy_find_hosts( 1, spec_obj, hosts, num_to_return=3, include_alternates=False) self.assertEqual(1, len(selected_hosts)) self.assertEqual(1, len(selected_hosts[0])) self.assertEqual('fake-host', selected_hosts[0][0].host)

commit_message:
zuul.d/projects.yaml: Sort the job list

Sort the job list to make it easier to compare the 'check' jobs and
the 'gate' jobs.

Put the non-voting jobs in their own section.

Remove the 'voting: false' part from the experimental jobs as it is
unneeded.  Experimental jobs do not have any voting powers. So it is
redundant to mark them as 'voting: false'

Change-Id: I6ad8797c6973e04ec6835cfbab7b74eb0bd85220

commit_message:
use qos api def from neutron-lib

The Qos extension's API definition was rehomed into neutron-lib with
commit I8ab3712850ec02278b3efb9161fc03236926b842 and neutron will
consume it with I3bb987920008d5a1d73cf4c5f37895d7f917c368

This patch removes the global attribute map update for the qos
extension in the Unit Tests. This isn't needed and is already handled in
extension loading.

Change-Id: Ibf957616cb1acacf2a61c138d354be9ccdf640b5

commit_message:
Add code for catch OVSFWPortNotFound exception.

This patch catch the OVSFWPortNotFound exception which raised by
get_ovs_port() function when ovs port not found.

Closes-Bug: #1730552

Change-Id: I6a5774fe8ffb167381282b855f0935f4b413432e

Add an action to report utilization

Using swift-recon -d, report disk-utilization in GB.

Change-Id: I02f9b85106046fc038a66c7059c23c8a89fd32b1
Closes-Bug: 1720258

commit_message:
Switch undercloud-containers to use oooq/fs027

Stop using logic in tripleo-ci and start using the featureset in
tripleo-quickstart in the gate.
It's an iteration toward using tripleo-quickstart in the gate for
undercloud-containers job, and move forward with having scenarios using
this role.

Change-Id: Ie4c84ee9ae56c223915ea3bb4bcad74c38a69f1f

commit_message:
Do deep redirects from old docs.openstack.org URLs

The docs.openstack.org site was rearranged so that the old docs at
/developer/heat/ are now at /heat/latest/. The base .htaccess file in
openstack-manuals redirects everything in the old hierarchy to the root
of the new one unless there is a .htaccess file present (see
I0af0e32d9c646d61f4c72599cdc4613299aa5ec9).

Add a .htaccess file so that old links redirect to the equivalent page
in the new location.

Change-Id: I74de09f4e25c2eda050053d3b8646586c9f24c04
Closes-Bug: #1722820
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/26/517426/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The top-level docs project will redirect URLs from the old /developer docs # to their equivalent pages on the new docs.openstack.org only if this file # exists.

commit_message:
Tripleoclient unified queue name.

This will allow the cli and tripleo UI to share a common queue,
which will help with scripting the frontend behaviour or track
the progress of the cli from the frontend.

Related-Bug: #1603345

Change-Id: I5849983eee82b5a56cae1bf38a3c2694b6b291db

commit_message:
Enable Cinder as a backend for Glance

Enable Cinder as a backend for Glance by adding 'cinder' to the list of
allowed choices for the GlanceBackend heat parameter.

Update the glance-api docker configuration to allow the feature to work.
This is necessary because the feature uses iSCSI, which requires additional
privileges.

Closes-Bug: #1728409
Depends-On: I850047e32f3608b3ce490e52e2e540695cb1a4ff
Change-Id: I42241747de931103a04aa5ee2ed18fd46197d183
(cherry picked from commit e828e8c7bb2e890b243faa767992226dc270bb6f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/00/516100/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Refactor undercloud deploy to use Ansible.

This patch refactors undercloud deploy:
- Cleans up the ordering so that you can plainly see what is happening.
- Calls heat to resolve the stack without actually doing anything.
- Downloads Ansible from resolved heat stack.
- Calls ansible directly with exec().
- Cleans up error handling to be very clear in the case of any errors
  from the script or from heat.
- Kills heat silently and reliably.
- Removes fake keystone.
- Removes any yum updates.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>

Depends-On: I03f1789957ba157871fd13164592116d7fcdabe4
Depends-On: I5413ae4eadd5affdd1ae01678b61eafbe50b7919
Change-Id: I9fce6477566b439ceb2b5dc25eae307af9c9cc2b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/67/515967/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import globimport tracebackfrom heatclient.common import utils as heat_utils# For ansible download from tripleo_common.utils import config ANSIBLE_INVENTORY = """ [targets] overcloud ansible_connection=local [Undercloud] overcloud [{hostname}] overcloud """ heat_pid = None def _download_ansible_playbooks(self, client): stack_config = config.Config(client) output_dir = os.environ.get('HOME') print('** Downloading undercloud ansible.. **') # python output buffering is making this seem to take forever.. sys.stdout.flush() stack_config.download_config('undercloud', output_dir) # Sadly the above writes the ansible config to a new directory each # time. This finds the newest new entry. ansible_dir = max(glob.iglob('%s/tripleo-*-config' % output_dir), key=os.path.getctime) # Write out the inventory file. with open('%s/inventory' % ansible_dir, 'w') as f: f.write(ANSIBLE_INVENTORY.format(hostname=self._get_hostname())) print('** Downloaded undercloud ansible to %s **' % ansible_dir) sys.stdout.flush() return ansible_dir # Intended to be called from a child process, never returns. def _launch_ansible(self, ansible_dir): os.chdir(ansible_dir) playbook_inventory = "%s/inventory" % (ansible_dir) cmd = ['ansible-playbook', '-i', playbook_inventory, 'deploy_steps_playbook.yaml', '-e', 'role_name=Undercloud', '-e', 'deploy_server_id=undercloud', '-e', 'bootstrap_server_id=undercloud'] print('Running Ansible: %s' % (' '.join(cmd))) # execvp() doesn't return. os.execvp(cmd[0], cmd) def _setup_heat_environments(self, parsed_args): with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(delete=False) as tmp_env_file: return environments def _wait_for_heat_complete(self, orchestration_client, stack_id, timeout): # Wait for the stack to go to COMPLETE. timeout_t = time.time() + 60 * timeout marker = None event_log_context = heat_utils.EventLogContext() kwargs = { 'sort_dir': 'asc', 'nested_depth': '6' } while True: time.sleep(2) events = event_utils.get_events( orchestration_client, stack_id=stack_id, event_args=kwargs, marker=marker) if events: marker = getattr(events[-1], 'id', None) events_log = heat_utils.event_log_formatter( events, event_log_context) print(events_log) status = orchestration_client.stacks.get(stack_id).status if status == 'FAILED': raise Exception('Stack create failed') if status == 'COMPLETE': break if time.time() > timeout_t: msg = 'Stack creation timeout: %d minutes elapsed' % (timeout) raise Exception(msg) def _launch_heat(self, parsed_args): # we do this as root to chown config files properly for docker, etc. if parsed_args.heat_native: self.heat_launch = heat_launcher.HeatNativeLauncher( parsed_args.heat_api_port, parsed_args.heat_container_image, parsed_args.heat_user) else: self.heat_launch = heat_launcher.HeatDockerLauncher( parsed_args.heat_api_port, parsed_args.heat_container_image, parsed_args.heat_user) # NOTE(dprince): we launch heat with fork exec because # we don't want it to inherit our args. Launching heat # as a "library" would be cool... but that would require # more refactoring. It runs a single process and we kill # it always below. self.heat_pid = os.fork() if self.heat_pid == 0: if parsed_args.heat_native: try: uid = pwd.getpwnam(parsed_args.heat_user).pw_uid gid = pwd.getpwnam(parsed_args.heat_user).pw_gid except KeyError: raise exceptions.DeploymentError( "Please create a %s user account before " "proceeding." % parsed_args.heat_user) os.setgid(gid) os.setuid(uid) self.heat_launch.heat_db_sync() # Exec() never returns. self.heat_launch.launch_heat() # NOTE(dprince): we use our own client here because we set # auth_required=False above because keystone isn't running when this # command starts tripleoclients = self.app.client_manager.tripleoclient orchestration_client = \ tripleoclients.local_orchestration(parsed_args.heat_api_port) return orchestration_client def _kill_heat(self): if self.heat_pid: self.heat_launch.kill_heat(self.heat_pid) pid, ret = os.waitpid(self.heat_pid, 0) self.heat_pid = None def _deploy_tripleo_heat_templates(self, orchestration_client, parsed_args): """Deploy the fixed templates in TripleO Heat Templates""" environments = self._setup_heat_environments(parsed_args) self.log.debug("Processing environment files") env_files, env = ( template_utils.process_multiple_environments_and_files( environments)) self.log.debug("Getting template contents") template_path = os.path.join(parsed_args.templates, 'overcloud.yaml') template_files, template = \ template_utils.get_template_contents(template_path) files = dict(list(template_files.items()) + list(env_files.items())) stack_name = parsed_args.stack self.log.debug("Deploying stack: %s", stack_name) self.log.debug("Deploying template: %s", template) self.log.debug("Deploying environment: %s", env) self.log.debug("Deploying files: %s", files) stack_args = { 'stack_name': stack_name, 'template': template, 'environment': env, 'files': files, } if parsed_args.timeout: stack_args['timeout_mins'] = parsed_args.timeout self.log.info("Performing Heat stack create") stack = orchestration_client.stacks.create(**stack_args) stack_id = stack['stack']['id'] return stack_id try: # Launch heat. orchestration_client = self._launch_heat(parsed_args) # Wait for heat to be ready. self._wait_local_port_ready(parsed_args.heat_api_port) # Deploy TripleO Heat templates. stack_id = \ self._deploy_tripleo_heat_templates(orchestration_client, parsed_args) # Wait for complete.. self._wait_for_heat_complete(orchestration_client, stack_id, parsed_args.timeout) # download the ansible playbooks and execute them. ansible_dir = \ self._download_ansible_playbooks(orchestration_client) # Kill heat, we're done with it now. self._kill_heat() # Never returns.. We exec() it directly. self._launch_ansible(ansible_dir) except Exception as e: print("Exception: %s" % e) print(traceback.format_exception(*sys.exc_info())) raise finally: # We only get here on error. print('ERROR: Heat log files: %s' % (self.heat_launch.install_tmp)) self._kill_heat() return 1

commit_message:
Add tags to baremetal cron removal tasks

In 59e29b17f4a9f5f65b6f8a7b8e82ef6426d8a51 we forgot to
add tags to the Ansible tasks to remove the baremetal
cron jobs at step 2.

(cherry picked from commit 1128271b460b120a2a59eac3df95082c55e554d0)

Change-Id: I23fb134b88336ebc4eb1a97a69a2d73d4ef0edb2
Related-bug: #1708466

commit_message:
Load all templates for generating parameter schema

To be able to handle parameter defaults properly, we need to load all
possible templates when merging the environments, to generate an
approximate schema.

Closes-Bug: #1669571
Change-Id: Idab781d3e6af92990c357a727aa60ec0aa8f5f05
(cherry picked from commit 7221cd2eba592cdb2097b3af52f9c297a54aae60)

commit_message:
Replace pycrypto with cryptography

Pycrypto is no longer maintained, and heat currently uses Pycrypto.
This patch rewrites functions using Pycrypto and replaces them with
cryptography functions.

See [1], [2] for reference.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113568.html
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/617715/

Change-Id: I27e7208e19726c5325bad2874e43f5d841779008
Co-Authored-By: Omar Tleimat <otleimat@ucla.edu>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/91/454891/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cryptography.hazmat.backends import default_backend from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.ciphers import algorithms from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.ciphers import Cipher from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.ciphers import modes self.cipher = importutils.import_module( 'cryptography.hazmat.primitives.ciphers.algorithms.' + enctype) iv = self.cipher.block_size backend = default_backend() cipher = Cipher(self.cipher(key), modes.CBC(iv), backend=backend) res = cipher.decryptor() res = cipher.update(msg) + cipher.finalize() # l = ord(padded[-1:]) + 1 # plain = padded[:-l] return res AES = algorithms.AES(encryption_key) iv = AES.block_size # cipher = AES.new(encryption_key, AES.MODE_CFB, iv) backend = default_backend() cipher = Cipher(AES, modes.CBC(iv), backend=backend) res = cipher.decryptor() res = res.update(auth) + res.finalize
deleted_lines: from Crypto.Cipher import AES self.cipher = importutils.import_module('Crypto.Cipher.' + enctype) iv = msg[:self.cipher.block_size] cipher = self.cipher.new(key, self.cipher.MODE_CBC, iv) padded = cipher.decrypt(msg[self.cipher.block_size:]) l = ord(padded[-1:]) + 1 plain = padded[:-l] return plain iv = auth[:AES.block_size] cipher = AES.new(encryption_key, AES.MODE_CFB, iv) res = cipher.decrypt(auth[AES.block_size:])

subject: Change `osd crush location` to `crush location`
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-08 02:59:48.000000000', 'files': ['templates/ceph.conf'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd/commit/efcd88640f6e7cb65e96c87c8bc032d9d2894ad9', 'message': 'Change `osd crush location` to `crush location`

Upstream Ceph removed the `osd crush location` option in
commit f9db479a14d9103a2b7c0a24d958fe5fff94100e [0]. This
causes new clusters deployed from the Pike UCA (Luminous)
using the customize-failure-domain option to not create or
move the OSD to the correct spot in the OSD tree. The end
result is that placement groups will fail to peer because
there are no racks to select hosts and OSDs from.

Instead, the charm should set the more generic `crush
location` option in the ceph.conf file. It is and has been
supported since the Firefly (trusty-icehouse) version of
Ceph.

[0] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/f9db479a14d9103a2b7c0a24d958fe5fff94100e

Change-Id: I0b7055b20f54096a2f33583079326aee17726355
Closes-Bug: 1730839
'}]
commit_message:
Change `osd crush location` to `crush location`

Upstream Ceph removed the `osd crush location` option in
commit f9db479a14d9103a2b7c0a24d958fe5fff94100e [0]. This
causes new clusters deployed from the Pike UCA (Luminous)
using the customize-failure-domain option to not create or
move the OSD to the correct spot in the OSD tree. The end
result is that placement groups will fail to peer because
there are no racks to select hosts and OSDs from.

Instead, the charm should set the more generic `crush
location` option in the ceph.conf file. It is and has been
supported since the Firefly (trusty-icehouse) version of
Ceph.

[0] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/f9db479a14d9103a2b7c0a24d958fe5fff94100e

Change-Id: I0b7055b20f54096a2f33583079326aee17726355
Closes-Bug: 1730839
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd refs/changes/35/518435/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: crush location = {{crush_location}}
deleted_lines: osd crush location = {{crush_location}}

commit_message:
Miss node_id in devstack lib

When installing devstack, found there is
a missing node id in devstack/lib/ironic
when root devices are less than 4Gb.

Change-Id: I331bfe1e6481dc0de2869166fc6a2a0398314735
Closes-Bug: #1730526

commit_message:
Add option to set external policy to local for openstack services

External traffic policy "local" would be preffered when openstack
service is accessed from external via node port. This option has an
effect only when service node port is enabled.

Change-Id: Ic68cfc59dc39dc842d4790deffa70efe433dd7a6

commit_message:
refresh agent if group membership changes

this broke when we switched to tooz partitioner
- ensure we trigger refresh if group changes
- ensure we have heartbeat or else members will just die.

- remove retain_common_targets tests because it doesn't make sense.
it was originally designed for when we had listener per pipeline
but that was changed 726b2d4d67ada3df07f36ecfd81b0cf72881e159
- remove testing workload partitioning path in standard notification
agent tests
- correct test_unique test to properly validate a single target
rather than the number of listeners we have.
- add test to ensure group_state is updated when a member joins
- add test to verify that listener assigned topics based on hashring

Closes-Bug: #1729617
Change-Id: I5039c93e6845a148c24094f755a78870d49ec19f
(cherry picked from commit 75cc518c2f86afd02a7e60df150148c8a0f2e813)

commit_message:
Revert "devstack: Set an optimal processing queue"

This reverts commit f1bdf6751a503ee570ce114f9a31fdb2959a79d0.

this causes distribution to be either 50/50 or 100/0. in the latter
case, the single worker usually fails to process pipeline queues in a
timely manner

Change-Id: I7c34acb29290de641ccbef4844e1e6982fe8b173
(cherry picked from commit 0dbdd043c4d4a62e66fc69ebfdbc7c6e1db243a3)

commit_message:
Handle and report SQLAlchemy errors

Add handling of SQLAlchemy errors into OSProfiler. For errors
profiler will emit stop event with information about error
(Python exception).

Closes bug: #1706299

Change-Id: Ib9c1ea2ee3fb0450b8591ff1164f3e7153c5472a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osprofiler refs/changes/87/514587/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import logging as logLOG = log.getLogger(__name__) sqlalchemy.event.listen(engine, "handle_error", handle_error) def handle_error(exception_context): """Handle SQLAlchemy errors""" original_exception = str(exception_context.original_exception) chained_exception = str(exception_context.chained_exception) info = { "db": { "original_exception": original_exception, "chained_exception": chained_exception, } } profiler.stop(info=info) LOG.debug("OSProfiler has handled SQLAlchemy error: %s", original_exception)

commit_message:
Fix test_horizon for curl

The horizon test script did not work when using curl. It went unnoticed
because we always use wget for testing.

The optional arguments POST_ARG and REFERER_ARG were uninitialized
(an error with nounset) and passed as empty string arguments if set
to an empty string.

This patch fixes the code path for curl.

Change-Id: I7baeb1b409d9bbd90eb57493f5428a7b9f404644
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/78/518278/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: POST_ARG="" REFERER_ARG="" [[ -v DATA ]] && POST_ARG="-d $DATA" [[ -v REFERER ]] && REFERER_ARG="--referer $REFERER" curl -L -c $COOKIE_FILE -b $COOKIE_FILE $POST_ARG --output "$OUTPUT_FILE"\ $REFERER_ARG -s "$URL"
deleted_lines: else POST_ARG="" else REFERER_ARG="" [[ -n "$DATA" ]] && POST_ARG="-d $DATA" [[ -n "$REFERER" ]] && REFERER_ARG="--referer $REFERER" curl -L -c $COOKIE_FILE -b $COOKIE_FILE "$POST_ARG" --output "$OUTPUT_FILE"\ "$REFERER_ARG" -s "$URL"

commit_message:
Extend messaging driver to support reporting

Messaging driver is extended to read profiling events
from RabbitMQ and generate report. This simplifies
usage of profiling in DevStack since Ceilometer is not
needed anymore.

The typical workflow is following:
1. User issues a command with profiling enabled:
   openstack --os-profile SECRET KEY <command>

2. User retrieves the trace:
   osprofiler trace show --connection messaging://
      --transport-url rabbit://<rabbituser>:<rabbitpassword>@<devstack>:5672/
      --json <trace-id>

Change-Id: I950896d6d9156f09e378bdfcf272aef5da4ece74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osprofiler refs/changes/59/514359/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @cliutils.arg("--transport-url", dest="transport_url", help="Oslo.messaging transport URL (for messaging:// driver " "only), e.g. rabbit://user:password@host:5672/")

stable branches to test even though it clones master. 
this is either gone or broken so it now pulls in master
and sticks with it.

commit_message:
[DNM] Fix Compress stackviz data failure

If subunit data doesn't exist, several tests will be skipped. Thefore the last
task - Compress stackviz data will be failed [1].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/09/512209/22/check/zun-tempest-py35-docker-sql/dfec799/ara/result/3b30ab25-ddca-420f-bf86-d2df0f372cb8/

Depends-On: I1d2b573334347908f88ffd22dc90bc6cca292d45
Change-Id: I80e96ffb3a02a8383fa344784b674ac831ab774f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/83/514583/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not run baremetal scenarios after Ocata

Pike is the release where we support containerized services, we don't
want to run baremetal scenarios anymore, so we save Infra resources.

We still have a few jobs running on baremetal, and they'll be cleanup
later but this iteration is just for the scenarios.

scenario001: only newton/ocata
scenario002: only newton/ocata
scenario003: only ocata
scenario004: only ocata

Change-Id: I7f1ef93a25bf8485facaec3f836df74ad218a719

commit_message:
check task_state in the live_migrate_instance

If server migration fails, the while loop will not break
until retry to 0,
we can check the task_state to avoid this situation.

Closes-Bug: #1728476
Change-Id: I07e1048eb736263a261456ee78c96fee9db13cb5

Use https instead of http to ensure the safety without containing our
account/password information

commit_message:
Fix workflow update

Updating a workflow resource was broken because of some unexpected
conditions filtering input, params and description. This removes those
conditions and update the workflow regularly.

Change-Id: I3bd187f8012bf4bddae1010fcf4a028c1829c644
(cherry picked from commit 721965f2ec7af7b584f13454cd5a41d68490dd47)

commit_message:
Update helm-toolkit sync mechanism across repos

This patch set adds in the mechanism to use zuul-cloner in the zuul-gate
to pull in openstack-helm's helm-toolkit.  This allows for CRD to work
as expected and the code can be centralized in the OS-H instead of three
repos: OS-H, OS-H-infra, and OS-H-addons.

Change-Id: Ia5558491b80413e86ce6f133aa50c565a1dc0374

commit_message:
Update l2pop calls to use context instead of session

With the introduction of OVO objects, most l2pop methods were updated to
use a context, and not a session:
Idf72866d36f27ad0aa9b7a0b53034d2db45cd56d

The OVS driver calls 2 of these methods, so update the related code to
pass the context along

Change-Id: I394f8a16a19bcd16d65a9fcfb985d6fb6217d093
Closes-Bug: #1730076

commit_message:
Update OpenStack Client syntax for graphs (doc)

The OSC syntax for specifying branching points in Service Graphs
is going to be different than initially designed. Instead of:

--port-chains pc1:pc2,pc3;pc2:pc4,pc5

Now it will look like:

--branching-point pc1:pc2,pc3 --branching-point pc2:pc4,pc5

Change-Id: Idcfdc0eacf373ed3961079edfdca948495c2ea1e
Partial-Bug: #1587486
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-sfc refs/changes/58/510858/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add retries to read-only db operations

To prevent possible failures because of operational errors
we should add retries and send additional requests to the
database.

This change will increase the overall stability of the system
and will avoid obscure errors from the database.

Change-Id: I9ddef565acabbbfaddcb96f6a850a21875e6dcd5
Closes-bug: #1730426

commit_message:
Fix typo in config options

Some drivers:transport:websocket options had dashes instead of
underscore which caused zaqar to ignore them.

Change-Id: I0a0d0ddf5704415745868d39d763df0e43a21a61
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Hervé <therve@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1727406
Closes-Bug: #1730179
(cherry picked from commit f68f5e92179c1f49726dca98796307ad3c8bb4fb)

commit_message:
Support no_auth mode in mistral client

Now it is impossible to send requests without authentication.
This patch allows to disable it if user doesn't provide auth_url
to the client.

Change-Id: I3b964e349dd6843ceb022264abe451a1b407786b
Closes-bug: #1730067
(cherry picked from commit aa65b57816bd29e31355b8cecc9b20d10b0aa307)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-mistralclient refs/changes/22/517922/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If auth url was provided then we perform an authentication, otherwise # just ignore this step if req.get('auth_url'): auth_handler = auth.get_auth_handler(auth_type) auth_response = auth_handler.authenticate(req, session=session) else: auth_response = {}
deleted_lines: auth_handler = auth.get_auth_handler(auth_type) auth_response = auth_handler.authenticate(req, session=session) or {}

commit_message:
Pass base service client config to get_credentials

The get_credentials helper in credentials_factory wraps
around auth.get_credentials but it fails to pass
the http_timeout. Fixing this by replacing the local dict
of configuration settings with config.get_service_config.

Change-Id: I3d6b54818f53c995c5d8359502bf9b8a80e797a1
Closes-bug: #1692484

commit_message:
DNM Set concurrency to 3

commit_message:
Only set clients when service/api is available

The clients.py module initialises and set attributes for all clients
available in Tempest, regardless of whether the corresponding service
/ api version is configured as available.

This cleanup helps ensuring that tests use the expected version of
services, and prepares client.py to become a stable interface for
plugins.

A few bits of code rely on client aliases being defined, regardless of
configuration. Those issues are exposed by this patch, and fixed here.

Services that have multiple major versions are keystone, cinder and
glance. For keystone the API version is controlled via configuration,
already before this patch. Cinder has a _latest client setup in the
clients module and that concept is completed in this patch.
Glance is handled in the base class of relevant tests.

Depends-on: I21f07f7b3e8f22055e7978c0bf4aa01b80b493d9
Change-Id: I8410297f7e80871e74aa64e6907ebbb9e0bba79f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/84/484384/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: known_services = clients.get_service_list() service_list = clients.get_service_list()
deleted_lines: def get_service_list(): service_list = { 'compute': CONF.service_available.nova, 'image': CONF.service_available.glance, 'volume': CONF.service_available.cinder, # NOTE(masayukig): We have two network services which are neutron and # nova-network. And we have no way to know whether nova-network is # available or not. After the pending removal of nova-network from # nova, we can treat the network/neutron case in the same manner as # the other services. 'network': True, # NOTE(masayukig): Tempest tests always require the identity service. # So we should set this True here. 'identity': True, 'object_storage': CONF.service_available.swift, } return service_list known_services = get_service_list() service_list = get_service_list()

commit_message:
Migrate object storage group to the new manager

Migrate the service clients in the object storage group to the
new client manager.

Change-Id: I52187f3979c822bf22007aea619542378f591f96
Partially-implements: bp client-manager-refactor
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/89/262989/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.services import object_storage for group in [compute, network, volume, volumev2, object_storage]: # NOTE: this function is used for logging purposes only, in case the # requested client name could not be found, and it's not a reliable # mean of separating group from service client name self.set_clients_group_params(object_storage.name, **params) for group in [compute, network, volume, volumev2, object_storage]:
deleted_lines: from tempest.services.object_storage.account_client import AccountClient from tempest.services.object_storage.container_client import ContainerClient from tempest.services.object_storage.object_client import ObjectClient for group in [compute, network, volume, volumev2]: # NOTE (!) This imposes a restriction that a group name cannot contain # underscore. self.account_client = AccountClient(self.auth_provider, **params) self.container_client = ContainerClient(self.auth_provider, **params) self.object_client = ObjectClient(self.auth_provider, **params) for group in [compute, network, volume, volumev2]:

subject: Split creds and resources in tenant isolation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-08 22:10:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/7f0996b87050afcb6ab068cb750b7117119473b6', 'message': "Split creds and resources in tenant isolation

WIP - do not merge

In resource-cleanup we split the class setup in several
steps, but in tenant isolation setup of network resources
is triggered automatically so it cannot be separated as-is.
Splitting the setup of credentials and of resources, so
that they can be executed in setup_credentials and
setup_resources respectively.

Expose the resource related methods at cred_provider
level as well, and provide a dummy implementation for now
on the preprovisioned accounts side. A full implementation
will be done here as part of the test-accounts-cont'ed bp.

Required network resources must still be declared at init
time, only they will actually be created later on, at
resource creation time. The reason for this is that in case
of preprovisioned accounts, we must know from the start
which resources are required, as resources will be
pre-provisioned as well.

Partially-implements: bp/resource-cleanup

Change-Id: I369d61c80207d883d00e8e398949ba6bda59b259

commit_message:
Split creds and resources in tenant isolation

In resource-cleanup we split the class setup in several
steps, but in tenant isolation setup of network resources
is triggered automatically so it cannot be separated as-is.
Splitting the setup of credentials and of resources, so
that they can be executed in setup_credentials and
setup_resources respectively.

Expose the resource related methods at cred_provider
level as well, and provide a dummy implementation for now
on the preprovisioned accounts side. A full implementation
will be done here as part of the test-accounts-cont'ed bp.

Required network resources must still be declared at init
time, only they will actually be created later on, at
resource creation time. The reason for this is that in case
of preprovisioned accounts, we must know from the start
which resources are required, as resources will be
pre-provisioned as well.

Partially-implements: bp/resource-cleanup

Change-Id: I369d61c80207d883d00e8e398949ba6bda59b259

commit_message:
Increase code coverage

Covers v2/shell.py:do_share_replica_delete().

This change removes unused branching and extends coverage by testing
raising errors when all replicas deletion failed.

The argument --force can never be None due to action 'store_true'.

Change-Id: I6eeb39921fe032688c172a0666f089ab12afe4c1
Partial-Bug: #1364800

commit_message:
Add Shelve/Unshelve policy tests

This patch adds RBAC test case for shelve/unshelve
server actions.

policy details [1]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/722cc06aad401fefa558dc5eba7d04fe615b5d51/nova/policies/shelve.py

Change-Id: I919cdeb51a9b45a1bb01dbf7268f352f2fc77148
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/80/515280/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _shelve_server(self): self.servers_client.shelve_server(self.server_id) self.addCleanup(self._cleanup_server_actions, self.servers_client.unshelve_server, self.server_id) offload_time = CONF.compute.shelved_offload_time if offload_time >= 0: waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.os_admin.servers_client, self.server_id, 'SHELVED_OFFLOADED', extra_timeout=offload_time) else: waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.os_admin.servers_client, self.server_id, 'SHELVED') def _cleanup_server_actions(self, action, server_id, **action_arg): server = self.servers_client.show_server(server_id)['server'] if server['status'] != 'ACTIVE': action(server_id, **action_arg) @decorators.idempotent_id('0b70c527-af75-4bed-9ccf-4f1310a8b60f') @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-shelve:shelve") def test_shelve_server(self): self.rbac_utils.switch_role(self, toggle_rbac_role=True) self._shelve_server() @decorators.attr(type='slow') @decorators.idempotent_id('4b6e849a-9182-49ff-9257-e97e751b475e') @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-shelve:unshelve") def test_unshelve_server(self): self._shelve_server() self.rbac_utils.switch_role(self, toggle_rbac_role=True) self.servers_client.unshelve_server(self.server_id) waiters.wait_for_server_status( self.os_admin.servers_client, self.server_id, 'ACTIVE')

commit_message:
Do not run baremetal scenarios after Ocata

Pike is the release where we support containerized services, we don't
want to run baremetal scenarios anymore, so we save Infra resources.

We still have a few jobs running on baremetal, and they'll be cleanup
later but this iteration is just for the scenarios.

scenario001: only newton/ocata
scenario002: only newton/ocata
scenario003: only ocata
scenario004: only ocata
scenario007: remove it (we have container job in pike/master)

Change-Id: I8587dfde9fe5772444ef942bf278c822e3c7b8f0

commit_message:
Correct policy action for attach/detach volume actions

This PS corrects the policy action for attach and detach
volume actions. There are a few policy actions that currently
have the wrong name. This PS is a pre-requsite for removing
strict_policy_enforce Patrole configuration option in order
to avoid false positives (e.g. a non-existent policy action
being validated against an API).

The os-attach volume actions actually enforces
"volume_extension:volume_actions:attach" and os-detach
actually enforces "volume_extension:volume_actions:detach" [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/ae7355c1f8d5d137bfb8bdf7b521ff5519cc20f8/cinder/policies/volume_actions.py#L224

Change-Id: I7d0c99ffb197832182e8f7b2af952f94acd29b0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/11/518211/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="cinder", rule="volume_extension:volume_actions:attach") @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="cinder", rule="volume_extension:volume_actions:detach")
deleted_lines: @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="cinder", rule="volume:attach") @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="cinder", rule="volume:detach")

commit_message:
Correct policy action for reserve/unreserve volume actions

This PS corrects the policy action for reserve and unreserve
volume actions. There are a few policy actions that currently
have the wrong name. This PS is a pre-requsite for removing
strict_policy_enforce Patrole configuration option in order
to avoid false positives (e.g. a non-existent policy action
being validated against an API).

The os-reserve volume actions actually enforces
"volume_extension:volume_actions:reserve" and os-unreserve
actually enforces "volume_extension:volume_actions:reserve" [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/ae7355c1f8d5d137bfb8bdf7b521ff5519cc20f8/cinder/policies/volume_actions.py#L197

Change-Id: Ib1b68cbde992b57619e877e0a4fe2f1948fdd6c1

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbooks path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I8d12ed45694048f0037f5d754bbb72f6c20c1a56

subject: Test shared and non-shared floating networks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-31 17:47:23.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/admin/test_floating_ips_admin_actions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/155200bf414dfcfb2531813446a7358096f74d90', 'message': 'Test shared and non-shared floating networks

floating network is the external network which floating ips are
allocated on.

The test_list_floating_ips_from_admin_and_nonadmin test verifies
the visibility of floating ips. The current implementation works
correctly for a non-shared, floating network.

For a shared network the test incorrectly fails. This change
verifies the floating ip visibility as follows:
 * if the floating network is shared, the floating ips are visible
 * if the floating network is not shared, the floating ips  are
   not visible

Change-Id: I8a341635eec2fdd4a285f0d8060dbacf443d6b4e
Closes-Bug: #1729047
'}]
commit_message:
Test shared and non-shared floating networks

floating network is the external network which floating ips are
allocated on.

The test_list_floating_ips_from_admin_and_nonadmin test verifies
the visibility of floating ips. The current implementation works
correctly for a non-shared, floating network.

For a shared network the test incorrectly fails. This change
verifies the floating ip visibility as follows:
 * if the floating network is shared, the floating ips are visible
 * if the floating network is not shared, the floating ips  are
   not visible

Change-Id: I8a341635eec2fdd4a285f0d8060dbacf443d6b4e
Closes-Bug: #1729047
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/47/516747/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # and floating ip that is created in another project (alt user) unless # the network the floating ips are allocated on is shared. ext_net = self.networks_client.show_network(self.ext_net_id)['network'] if ext_net['shared']: self.assertIn(floating_ip_admin['floatingip']['id'], floating_ip_ids) self.assertIn(floating_ip_alt['id'], floating_ip_ids) else: self.assertNotIn(floating_ip_admin['floatingip']['id'], floating_ip_ids) self.assertNotIn(floating_ip_alt['id'], floating_ip_ids)
deleted_lines: # and floating ip that is created in another project (alt user) self.assertNotIn(floating_ip_admin['floatingip']['id'], floating_ip_ids) self.assertNotIn(floating_ip_alt['id'], floating_ip_ids)

commit_message:
test_network_v6: log instance addresses on failure

If a test case failed to wait before an IP address was configured for an
instance, it may be helpful to log what is actually in the 'ip address'
output to help debugging test failures.

Change-Id: I979420661a980fea148df1731771147d531a5ecb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/08/518108/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug('ip address output\n%s', ssh.exec_command("ip address"))

commit_message:
Remove legacy connector constants

These constants were moved over a year ago and we have had several releases
since then. The old ones that were kept for backwards compatibility can now
be removed.

Depends-on: I8682804d2299db793c1e4397a07ff67608a8bda6
Change-Id: Ia18de03880ca5b04d31dbdf7891fa6d3240ae9b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/02/509502/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | The location for connector constants was moved in the 1.6.0 release, but their old location was kept for backwards compatibility. These legacy constants are now being removed and any out of tree code should be updated to use the latest location (os_brick.iniitator.CONSTANT_NAME).

commit_message:
Fix version maps for snaps and debs

This ensures that charms don't try to upgrade themselves everytime
an update-status hook call occurs; specifically we need to map the
numerical version to the latest OpenStack release that carries
that version for the UCA.

Gnocchi does always major release with OpenStack.

Change-Id: I777097c5188c73523fc4c41fc698b6dc6a87fd24

commit_message:
refresh agent if group membership changes

this broke when we switched to tooz partitioner
- ensure we trigger refresh if group changes
- ensure we have heartbeat or else members will just die.

- remove retain_common_targets tests because it doesn't make sense.
it was originally designed for when we had listener per pipeline
but that was changed 726b2d4d67ada3df07f36ecfd81b0cf72881e159
- remove testing workload partitioning path in standard notification
agent tests
- correct test_unique test to properly validate a single target
rather than the number of listeners we have.
- add test to ensure group_state is updated when a member joins
- add test to verify that listener assigned topics based on hashring

Closes-Bug: #1729617
Change-Id: I5039c93e6845a148c24094f755a78870d49ec19f

commit_message:
Revert "devstack: Set an optimal processing queue"

This reverts commit f1bdf6751a503ee570ce114f9a31fdb2959a79d0.

this causes distribution to be either 50/50 or 100/0. in the latter
case, the single worker usually fails to process pipeline queues in a
timely manner

Change-Id: I7c34acb29290de641ccbef4844e1e6982fe8b173

commit_message:
Switch the deprecated "ironic" CLI to "latest" API version by default

The functional tests were updated to account for the initial state changed
to "enroll" and for new fields appearing in "show" and "update" responses.

Closes-Bug: #1671145
Change-Id: Ida18541fbbc8064868cac0accb6919de08e9f795

commit_message:
Readd legacy-puppet-syntax-3-centos-7 playbook

This was removed by accident in
I8d5a3471e7c6171848bddc9e35c0c63283d175a0 but is actually used.
Add it back in.

Closes-Bug: #1730477
Change-Id: I4e5a9d4e048d7afbe63b7f25b1bdc23f23fc63e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs refs/changes/62/518362/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - hosts: all name: Autoconverted job legacy-puppet-syntax-3-legacy-centos-7 from old job gate-{name}-puppet-syntax-3-legacy-centos-7 tasks: - name: Ensure legacy workspace directory file: path: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' state: directory - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x CLONEMAP=`mktemp` function cleanup { # In cases where zuul-cloner is aborted during a git # clone operation, git will remove the git work tree in # its cleanup. The work tree in these jobs is the # workspace directory, which means that subsequent # jenkins post-build actions can not run because the # workspace has been removed. # To reduce the likelihood of this having an impact, # recreate the workspace directory if needed mkdir -p $WORKSPACE rm -f $CLONEMAP } trap cleanup EXIT cat > $CLONEMAP << EOF clonemap: - name: $ZUUL_PROJECT dest: . EOF /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m $CLONEMAP --cache-dir /opt/git \ git://git.openstack.org $ZUUL_PROJECT executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x if [ -f /usr/bin/yum ]; then sudo yum -y remove rdo-release "centos-release-openstack-*" "centos-release-ceph-*" sudo yum -y install libxml2-devel libxslt-devel ruby-devel zlib-devel sudo yum -y groupinstall "Development Tools" # Uninstall python-requests from pip, since we install it in # system-config/install_puppet.sh sudo pip uninstall requests -y || true elif [ -f /usr/bin/apt-get ]; then sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install -y libxml2-dev libxslt-dev ruby-dev zlib1g-dev fi executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -x sudo rm -f /etc/sudoers.d/zuul # Prove that general sudo access is actually revoked ! sudo -n true executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | export PUPPET_GEM_VERSION='~> 3' mkdir .bundled_gems export GEM_HOME=`pwd`/.bundled_gems gem install bundler --no-rdoc --no-ri --verbose $GEM_HOME/bin/bundle install --retry 3 # FUTURE_PARSER=yes is only supported by Puppet 3.x if [ "3" -lt "4" ]; then export FUTURE_PARSER=yes fi $GEM_HOME/bin/bundle exec rake syntax chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}'

commit_message:
Allow IPv6 gateways for the default route

Remove assumption that subnets and gateways are always ipv4 in
the NetApp driver.

Partially implements: bp netapp-ontap-ipv6-support

Change-Id: Ia26d55368aa5a08da7e0941170ed2ac23db307d4

commit_message:
Fixes URL path for SFC v2 Driver

Due to this fix https://review.openstack.org/#/c/496388/,
now URL for OpenDaylight driver is not created correctly.

Correct url has format

http://<hostname>/controller/nb/v2/neutron/sfc/portpairs

Now it produces

http://<hostname>/controller/nb/v2/neutron/sfc/port-pairs

Closes-Bug: 1724644
Partial-bug: #1713697
Duplicate-patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/512951/

Change-Id: Ie4a75323694c69aaa5e682890647beaf461b6888
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rajiv Kumar <rajiv.kumar@nectechnologies.in>
(cherry picked from commit 7366ac0455a335e8f56a8467515bca33f3d29e28)

"}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2017-11-07 10:51:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.context/commit/c7c982b6127b8238625f81c2dafc2932ac3d2811', 'message': "Ouput a null value or a hash instead of the auth_token

As the name of the get_logging_values suggests, that function will
get entries from the context for logging purposes. For this, we
shouldn't need the auth_token since it might potentially leak
in the logs.

This filters out the auth_token by setting it as a null value by
default, however, it's possible to still get a token identifier, since
it adds the option to get a hash of the token instead.

The aforementioned option to get a hashed auth_token is useful in
auditing cases, and in attempting to spot malicious activity, as it
singles out a token that's used and allows for filtering based on that.
This way, even if a malicious actor manages to take over a token and
impersonate another user (by overwritting X-User-Id or similar fields)
we will still be able to spot that the same token was used.

Change-Id: I2b245c1665c3587be3c476b803122788d186e5d5
"}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2017-11-07 11:05:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.context/commit/f4427a6c56ea32444a466f5c9246e9680e54e49e', 'message': "Ouput a placeholder instead of the auth_token

get entries from the context for logging purposes. For this, we

in the logs.

commit_message:
Ouput a placeholder instead of the auth_token

As the name of the get_logging_values suggests, that function will
get entries from the context for logging purposes. For this, we
shouldn't need the auth_token since it might potentially leak
in the logs.

This filters out the auth_token by setting it as '***' by
default.

Change-Id: I2b245c1665c3587be3c476b803122788d186e5d5

commit_message:
Adds Neutron parameter max_allowed_address_pair

Adds a new Puppet parameter "max_allowed_address_pair" which goes into
the neutron.conf configuration file and allows to change that parameter
to any number (default is 10).

Change-Id: Id187696a28c9e721aa4a62a2208e9c8b8397f1ed
Closes-Bug: 1730367

commit_message:
Add dnsmasq_local_resolv option

Add 'dnsmasq_local_resolv' option support to Enables the dnsmasq
service to provide name resolution for instances via DNS resolvers
on the host running the DHCP agent.

Change-Id: I451777a573fd31dd5d6732303956f17bb67c22e0
Closes-Bug: #1728795

commit_message:
Add ability of managing ssh key generation

This patch add the ability to generate ssh key pair for Amphora
instances to use, it will be disabled by default.

Depends-On: I641c3a380c5647d28535914e3a6fb5dd793b6fba

Change-Id: I0e7c7df629600f027220272613fc0c85c9d27d76

commit_message:
Fix ocata gate issues

This includes two changes:

1. set CEILOMETER_BACKEND=mysql for pike/ocata
2. Switch integration jobs to use local mirrors

The Fedora 24 image mirror used does not exist anymore.
Let's use Fedora 26 and the nodepool morrors.

Change-Id: I42490c82a37a179414b5d34f547df4d145ee8aa7
Closes-Bug: #1728883
(cherry picked from commit 7d0ce4a1be11a28d60cd40342afe6a6aa2b66d1c
and a47e342f4d0cad4ff314a3f546b6661c8ec67777)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/84/516584/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use infra publish jobs

The legacy job does the same as the infra publish job, so use that one
directly via the publish-openstack-sphinx-docs-infra template.

For openstack-zuul-jobs, use publish-openstack-sphinx-docs-infra instead
of individual jobs.

Needed-By: I253cf2d5aef8a731d2632d4b683f80d21083c93a
Change-Id: I99082384c638a159e2600bd8da97b86e93c77c2a
